analyzed: śṛṇvan gṛṇan saṃsmarayan ca cintayan

analyzed: nāmāni rūpāṇi ca maṅgalāni te

analyzed: kriyāsu yaḥ tvad caraṇa aravindayoḥ

analyzed: āviṣṭa cetāḥ na bhavāya kalpate  diṣṭyā hare syāḥ bhavataḥ padaḥ

analyzed: drakṣyāma gām dyām ca tava anukampitām

analyzed: na te bhavasya īśa bhavasya kāraṇam vinā vinodam bata tarkayāmahe

You have taken incarnations as a fish, tortoise, boar, man-lion, swan,

translated: and as a king, a brāhmaṇa and a demigod.

analyzed: tvam pāsi naḥ tribhuvanam ca yathā adhunā īśa  bhāram bhuvaḥ hara yadu uttama vandanam te  diṣṭyā amba te kukṣi gataḥ paraḥ pumān
translated: O Lord, just as You protect us and the three worlds now,🔽please remove the burden of the earth, O best of the Yadus. We offer You our salutations.🔽By good fortune, the Supreme Lord Himself, the highest male being, has entered Your womb

analyzed: aṃśena sākṣāt bhagavān bhavāya naḥ

analyzed: goptā yadūnām bhavitā tava ātmajaḥ

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

analyzed: iti abhiṣṭūya puruṣam yad rūpam an idam yathā

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca  atha sarva guṇa upetaḥ kālaḥ parama śobhanaḥ
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

translated: a pure breeze blew, pleasant to the touch, carrying auspicious scents,

analyzed: jāyamāne jane tasmin neduḥ dundubhayaḥ samam

analyzed: devakyām deva rūpiṇyām viṣṇuḥ sarva guhā āśayaḥ
translated: In Devaki, who was of divine form, Vishnu, the abode of all mysteries,

analyzed: āvirāsīt yathā prācyām diśi induḥ iva puṣkalaḥ

analyzed: sa vismaya utphulla vilocanaḥ harim sutam vilokya ānakadundubhiḥ tadā

original: athainam astaud avadhārya pūruṣaṃ paraṃ natāṅgaḥ kṛtadhīḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ

analyzed: sva rociṣā bhārata sūtikāgṛham virocayantam gata bhīḥ prabhāva vid

The embodiment of the bliss of pure experience, the seer of all consciousness.

analyzed: yathā ime vikṛtāḥ bhāvāḥ tathā te vikṛtaiḥ saha
translated: Just as these unmanifest elements, along with their manifest forms,

analyzed: sannipatya samutpādya dṛśyante nugatāḥ iva

analyzed: anāvṛta tvāt bahis antaram na te sarvasya sarva ātmanaḥ ātma vastunaḥ

analyzed: tvattaḥ sya janma sthiti saṃyamān vibho

analyzed: vadanti anīhāt aguṇāt avikriyāt

analyzed: bibharṣi śuklam khalu varṇam ātmanaḥ

analyzed: sargāya raktam rajasā upabṛṃhitam

analyzed: kṛṣṇam ca varṇam tamasā jana atyaye

original: tvam asya lokasya vibho rirakṣiṣur gṛhe 'vatīrṇo 'si mamākhileśvara
analyzed: tvam asya lokasya vibhoḥ rirakṣiṣuḥ gṛhe vatīrṇaḥ si mama akhila īśvara

analyzed: rājanya saṃjñā asura koṭi yūthapaiḥ nirvyūhyamānā nihaniṣyase camūḥ  ayam tu asabhyaḥ tava janma nau gṛhe
translated: You will kill the armies that are being arrayed by the leaders of millions of demons known as Rajanyas.🔽But this uncivilized one, having heard that You have taken birth in our house,

analyzed: śrutvā agrajān te nyavadhīt sureśvara  sa te vatāram puruṣaiḥ samarpitam

analyzed: śrutvā adhunā eva abhisarati udāyudhaḥ

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca  athā enam ātmajam vīkṣya mahā puruṣa lakṣaṇam
translated: Śrī Śuka said:🔽Then Devakī, seeing her son with the marks of the Supreme Personality of Godhead,

analyzed: devakī tam upādhāvat kaṃsāt bhītā su vismitā
translated: was frightened of Kaṃsa and became very astonished. She approached Him.

analyzed: śrī devakī uvāca
translated: Śrī Devakī said:

original: rūpaṃ yat tat prāhur avyaktam ādyaṃ
analyzed: rūpam yat tat prāhuḥ avyaktam ādyam
translated: That form which they describe as unmanifest, primordial,

analyzed: brahma jyotiḥ nirguṇam nirvikāram
translated: the light of Brahman, qualityless, and immutable,
You are mere existence, without distinctions, without activity,

analyzed: sa tvam sākṣāt viṣṇuḥ adhyātma dīpaḥ
translated: You are Vishnu himself, the lamp of the soul,

original: naṣṭe loke dviparārdhāvasāne mahābhūteṣv ādibhūtaṃ gateṣu
analyzed: naṣṭe loke dvi parārdha avasāne mahābhūteṣu ādi bhūtam gateṣu

analyzed: vyakte vyaktam kāla vegena yāte bhavān ekaḥ śiṣyate śeṣa saṃjñaḥ
translated: And the manifest has gone back to the unmanifest by the force of time, you alone remain, known as the all-pervading one.

analyzed: yaḥ yam kālaḥ tasya te vyakta bandho  ceṣṭām āhuḥ ceṣṭate yena viśvam
translated: This time, O you whose form is unmanifest,🔽They say is your activity, by which the universe moves.

analyzed: nimeṣa ādiḥ vatsara antaḥ mahīyān
translated: Beginning with a twinkling of an eye and ending with a year, it is great.

analyzed: tam tvā īśānam kṣema dhāma prapadye
translated: I take refuge in you, the lord of prosperity and peace.

analyzed: martyaḥ mṛtyu vyāla bhītaḥ palāyan lokān sarvān nirbhayam na adhyagacchat
translated: A mortal, frightened of the terrible death, fleeing, did not find any world free from fear.

analyzed: tvat pāda abjam prāpya yadṛcchayā adya susthaḥ śete mṛtyuḥ asmāt apaiti
translated: Having reached your lotus feet by chance, he now sleeps peacefully, and death departs from him.

analyzed: sa tvam ghorāt ugrasena ātmajān naḥ trāhi trastān bhṛtya vitrāsa hā asi
translated: Protect us, the sons of Ugrasena, from the terrible one. You are capable of frightening even the servants.

original: rūpaṃ cedaṃ pauruṣaṃ dhyānadhiṣṇyaṃ mā pratyakṣaṃ māṃsadṛśāṃ kṛṣīṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: rūpam ca idam pauruṣam dhyāna dhiṣṇyam mā pratyakṣam māṃsa dṛśām kṛṣīṣṭhāḥ

analyzed: janma te mayi asau pāpaḥ mā vidyāt madhusūdana

analyzed: samudvije bhavat hetoḥ kaṃsāt aham adhīra dhīḥ

analyzed: upasaṃhara viśvātman adaḥ rūpam alaukikam

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā padma śriyā juṣṭam caturbhujam
translated: Endowed with the beauty of the conch, discus, mace, and lotus, with four arms,

analyzed: viśvam yat etat sva tanau niśā ante yathāvakāśam puruṣaḥ paraḥ bhavān
translated: O supreme person, at the end of the night, you assume this universe in your own body, according to the available space.

analyzed: bibharti saḥ yam mama garbha gaḥ bhūt aho nṛ lokasya viḍambanam hi tat

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca

analyzed: tvam eva pūrva sarge bhūḥ pṛśniḥ svāyambhuve sati
translated: In the previous creation, you were Pṛśni in the Svāyambhuva Manu period.

analyzed: tadā ayam sutapāḥ nāma prajāpatiḥ akalmaṣaḥ
translated: This one is named Sutapā, a faultless Prajāpati.

original: yuvāṃ vai brahmaṇādiṣṭau prajāsarge yadā tataḥ
analyzed: yuvām vai brahmaṇā ādiṣṭau prajā sarge yadā tatas
translated: When you two were commanded by Brahmā to create beings,

analyzed: san niyamya indriya grāmam tepāthe paramam tapaḥ
translated: you restrained the group of senses and performed the highest austerity.

analyzed: varṣa vāta ātapa hima gharma kāla guṇān anu  sahamānau śvāsa rodha vinirdhūta manaḥ malau
translated: Following the qualities of rain, wind, sun, cold, and heat,🔽enduring them, with breath control and mind purified by exhalation,

analyzed: śīrṇa parṇa anila āhārau upaśāntena cetasā
translated: subsisting on withered leaves and wind, with a tranquil mind,

analyzed: mattaḥ kāmān abhīpsantau mad ārādhanam īhatuḥ
translated: desiring desires from me, you two sought to propitiate me.

original: evaṃ vāṃ tapyatos tīvraṃ tapaḥ paramaduṣkaram
analyzed: evam vām tapyatoḥ tīvram tapaḥ parama duṣkaram
translated: Thus, while you two were performing severe austerities, extremely difficult to perform,

analyzed: divya varṣa sahasrāṇi dvādaśa īyuḥ mad ātmanoḥ
translated: for twelve thousand divine years, devoted to me,

analyzed: tadā vām parituṣṭaḥ ham amunā vapuṣā anaghe
translated: Then, O sinless one, I was pleased with you both, with this form,

original: tapasā śraddhayā nityaṃ bhaktyā ca hṛdi bhāvitaḥ
analyzed: tapasā śraddhayā nityam bhaktyā ca hṛdi bhāvitaḥ
translated: by your austerity, faith, and devotion always cherished in the heart.

analyzed: prādurāsam vara da rāj yuvayoḥ kāma ditsayā
translated: I appeared as the bestower of boons, desiring to grant you both what you wished.

original: vriyatāṃ vara ity ukte mādṛśo vāṃ vṛtaḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: vriyatām varaḥ iti ukte mādṛśaḥ vām vṛtaḥ sutaḥ
translated: When it was said, Choose a boon, you chose a son like me.

analyzed: ajuṣṭa grāmya viṣayau anapatyau ca dampatī
translated: The couple, whose objects of enjoyment were not enjoyed by the villagers, and who were childless,

analyzed: na vavrāthe pavargam me mohitau deva māyayā
translated: did not choose final liberation from me, deluded by the divine illusion.

original: gate mayi yuvāṃ labdhvā varaṃ matsadṛśaṃ sutam
analyzed: gate mayi yuvām labdhvā varam mad sadṛśam sutam
translated: When I had gone, you two, having obtained a son like me as a boon,

analyzed: grāmyān bhogān abhuñjāthām yuvām prāpta manorathau
translated: enjoyed worldly pleasures, having obtained your desire.

analyzed: a dṛṣṭvā anyatamam loke śīla audārya guṇaiḥ samam

analyzed: evam sādhāraṇam deham avyakta prabhava apyayam
translated: Thus, the body is common, and its origin and dissolution are not manifest.

original: ko vidvān ātmasāt kṛtvā hanti jantūn ṛte 'sataḥ
analyzed: kaḥ vidvān ātmasāt kṛtvā hanti jantūn ṛte sataḥ
translated: What wise person, having made it one's own, would kill living beings, except for an evil one?

analyzed: asataḥ śrī mada andhasya dāridryam param añjanam
translated: For an evil one blinded by the intoxication of wealth, poverty is the greatest collyrium.

original: ātmaupamyena bhūtāni daridraḥ param īkṣate🔽yathā kaṇṭakaviddhāṅgo jantor necchati tāṃ vyathām
analyzed: ātma aupamyena bhūtāni daridraḥ param īkṣate  yathā kaṇṭaka viddha aṅgaḥ jantoḥ nā icchati tām vyathām
translated: A poor person regards all beings as equal to himself.🔽Just as one whose body is pierced by thorns does not wish that pain for any being,

original: jīvasāmyaṃ gato liṅgair na tathāviddhakaṇṭakaḥ🔽daridro nirahaṃstambho muktaḥ sarvamadair iha
analyzed: jīva sāmyam gataḥ liṅgaiḥ na tathā viddha kaṇṭakaḥ  daridraḥ muktaḥ sarva madaiḥ iha

original: kṛcchraṃ yadṛcchayāpnoti tad dhi tasya paraṃ tapaḥ
analyzed: kṛcchram yadṛcchayā āpnoti tat hi tasya param tapaḥ

analyzed: nityam kṣudh kṣāma dehasya daridrasya anna kāṅkṣiṇaḥ

analyzed: indriyāṇi anuśuṣyanti hiṃsā api vinivartate

analyzed: daridrasya eva yujyante sādhavaḥ sama darśinaḥ

analyzed: sadbhiḥ kṣiṇoti tam tarṣam tatas ārāt viśuddhi ati
translated: One who is truly wise destroys that thirst, and then becomes pure.

analyzed: sādhūnām samacittānām mukunda caraṇa eṣiṇām
translated: Those who are good, who have equanimity, and who seek the feet of Mukunda,

analyzed: upekṣyaiḥ kim dhana stambhaiḥ asadbhiḥ asat āśrayaiḥ  tat aham mattayoḥ mādhvyā vāruṇyā śrī mada andhayoḥ
translated: What is the use of wealth and pride, which are inauspicious and the refuge of the wicked?🔽Therefore, I will remove the intoxication of darkness from those two intoxicated with the sweet wine of wealth and the intoxication of beauty,

analyzed: tamaḥ madam hariṣyāmi straiṇayoḥ ajita ātmanoḥ

analyzed: vṛtte svarloka tām bhūyas labdha bhaktī bhaviṣyataḥ

analyzed: yasya avatārāḥ jñāyante śarīreṣu aśarīriṇaḥ

analyzed: sa bhavān sarva lokasya bhavāya vibhavāya ca
translated: You, for the prosperity and well-being of all the worlds,

analyzed: avatīrṇaḥ ṃśa bhāgena sāmpratam patiḥ āśiṣām
translated: have now descended with a part, as the lord of blessings.

analyzed: namaḥ parama kalyāṇa namaḥ parama maṅgala
translated: Salutations to the supremely auspicious one, salutations to the supremely fortunate one.

original: vāsudevāya śāntāya yadūnāṃ pataye namaḥ🔽anujānīhi nau bhūmaṃs tavānucarakiṅkarau
analyzed: vāsudevāya śāntāya yadūnām pataye namaḥ  anujānīhi nau bhūman tava anucara kiṅkarau
translated: Salutations to Vasudeva, the peaceful one, to the lord of the Yadus.🔽O lord, please grant permission to us, your followers and servants,

analyzed: darśanam nau bhagavataḥ ṛṣeḥ āsīt anugrahāt
translated: to see the illustrious one, by the grace of the sage.

analyzed: vāṇī guṇa anukathane śravaṇau kathāyām

original: hastau ca karmasu manas tava pādayor naḥ
analyzed: hastau ca karmasu manaḥ tava pādayoḥ naḥ
translated: our hands for performing duties, our mind for Your feet,

analyzed: smṛtyām śiraḥ tava nivāsa jagat praṇāme
translated: our memory for remembering You, our head for bowing to the world that is Your abode,

analyzed: dṛṣṭiḥ satām darśane stu bhavat tanūnām
translated: and our eyes for seeing the bodies of the saintly devotees.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

analyzed: ittham saṅkīrtitaḥ tābhyām bhagavān gokula īśvaraḥ
translated: Thus the Lord, the master of Gokula, was praised by them.

original: dāmnā colūkhale baddhaḥ prahasann āha guhyakau
analyzed: dāmnā ca ulūkhale baddhaḥ prahasan āha guhyakau
translated: Bound by a rope to the mortar, He smilingly spoke to the two Guhyakas:

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Supreme Lord said:

analyzed: jñātam mama purā eva etat ṛṣiṇā karuṇa ātmanā
translated: This was known to me earlier by the sage, the embodiment of compassion,

analyzed: yat śrī mada andhayoḥ vāgbhiḥ vibhraṃśaḥ nugrahaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: that by Your words, blinded by pride, I was made to fall, which is actually a blessing.

analyzed: sādhūnām samacittānām sutarām mad kṛtātmanām
translated: For the saintly devotees, who are impartial and have fully dedicated themselves to Me,

original: darśanān no bhaved bandhaḥ puṃso 'kṣṇoḥ savitur yathā
analyzed: darśanāt naḥ bhavet bandhaḥ puṃso kṣṇoḥ savituḥ yathā
translated: by seeing Me, bondage does not occur, just as for the eyes by the sun.

analyzed: tat gacchatam mad paramau nalakūvara sādanam
translated: Therefore, go to the abode of Nalakūvara, which is Mine.

original: sañjāto mayi bhāvo vām īpsitaḥ paramo 'bhavaḥ
analyzed: sañjātaḥ mayi bhāvaḥ vām īpsitaḥ paramaḥ bhavaḥ
translated: The affection You have generated for Me is the highest and most desirable.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

original: ity uktau tau parikramya praṇamya ca punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: iti uktau tau parikramya praṇamya ca punar punar
translated: Thus addressed, they circumambulated Him and bowed again and again.

analyzed: baddha ulūkhalam āmantrya jagmatuḥ diśam uttarām
translated: Taking leave of Him, bound to the mortar, they went to the northern direction.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

original: gopā nandādayaḥ śrutvā drumayoḥ patato ravam
analyzed: gopāḥ nanda ādayaḥ śrutvā drumayoḥ patataḥ ravam
translated: The cowherds headed by Nanda, hearing the sound of the falling trees,

analyzed: tatra ājagmuḥ kuru śreṣṭha nirghāta bhaya śaṅkitāḥ
translated: went there, O best of the Kurus, fearing an earthquake.

analyzed: bhūmyām nipatitau tatra dadṛśuḥ yamalārjunau
translated: They saw the twin Arjuna trees fallen on the ground,

analyzed: babhramuḥ tat a vijñāya lakṣyam patana kāraṇam
translated: and being unable to understand the cause of their fall, they became confused.

original: ulūkhalaṃ vikarṣantaṃ dāmnā baddhaṃ ca bālakam
analyzed: ulūkhalam vikarṣantam dāmnā baddham ca bālakam
translated: They saw the child tied with a rope, dragging the mortar,

original: kasyedaṃ kuta āścaryam utpāta iti kātarāḥ
analyzed: kasya idam kutas āścaryam utpātaḥ iti kātarāḥ
translated: and the timid ones said, Whose is this? Where did this wonder come from? Is it an omen?

analyzed: bālāḥ ūcuḥ anena iti tiryak gatam ulūkhalam
translated: The children said, It is his, pointing to the one moving sideways like a beast.

analyzed: vikarṣatā madhya gena puruṣau api acakṣmahi
translated: We saw two men dragged by the one in the middle.

original: na te taduktaṃ jagṛhur na ghaṭeteti tasya tat
analyzed: na te tat uktam jagṛhuḥ na ghaṭeta iti tasya tat
translated: They did not accept his words, saying it was not possible.

original: bālasyotpāṭanaṃ tarvoḥ kecit sandigdhacetasaḥ🔽ulūkhalaṃ vikarṣantaṃ dāmnā baddhaṃ svam ātmajam
analyzed: bālasya utpāṭanam tarvoḥ kecid sandigdha cetasaḥ  ulūkhalam vikarṣantam dāmnā baddham svam ātmajam
translated: Some, with doubtful minds, said that the uprooting of the trees was done by the child.

original: vilokya nandaḥ prahasad vadano vimumoca ha
analyzed: vilokya nandaḥ prahasat vadanaḥ vimumoca ha
translated: Seeing his own son tied with a rope, dragging the mortar, Nanda, with a smiling face, let go of him.

original: gopībhiḥ stobhito 'nṛtyad bhagavān bālavat kvacit🔽udgāyati kvacin mugdhas tadvaśo dāruyantravat
analyzed: gopībhiḥ stobhitaḥ nṛtyat bhagavān bāla vat kvacid  udgāyati kvacid mugdhaḥ tad vaśaḥ dāruyantra vat
translated: Sometimes the Lord, stopped by the cowherdesses, did not dance like a child.🔽Sometimes, being under their control, he sang like a simpleton, like a wooden machine.

analyzed: bibharti kvacid ājñaptaḥ pīṭhaka unmāna pādukam
translated: Sometimes, commanded, he carried a seat, a measuring rod, and sandals.

original: bāhukṣepaṃ ca kurute svānāṃ ca prītim āvahan
analyzed: bāhukṣepam ca kurute svānām ca prītim āvahan
translated: And he waved his arms, causing delight to his kinsmen.

analyzed: darśayan tad vidām loke ātmanaḥ bhṛtya vaśya tām
translated: Displaying to the people who knew him his control over his servants,

analyzed: vrajasya uvāha vai harṣam bhagavān bāla ceṣṭitaiḥ
translated: The Lord brought joy to the cowherds with his childish activities.

original: krīṇīhi bhoḥ phalānīti śrutvā satvaram acyutaḥ
analyzed: krīṇīhi bhoḥ phalāni iti śrutvā sa tvaram acyutaḥ
translated: Hearing Buy fruits, O sir, Achyuta (Krishna) quickly went there,

original: phalārthī dhānyam ādāya yayau sarvaphalapradaḥ🔽phalavikrayiṇī tasya cyutadhānyakaradvayam
analyzed: phala arthī dhānyam ādāya yayau sarva phala pradaḥ  phala vikrayiṇī tasya cyuta dhānya kara dvayam
translated: Desiring fruits, taking grains, he went, being the giver of all fruits.🔽The fruit-seller filled his two hands that were empty with fruits,

original: phalair apūrayad ratnaiḥ phalabhāṇḍam apūri ca
analyzed: phalaiḥ apūrayat ratnaiḥ phala bhāṇḍam apūri ca
translated: And filled his fruit-basket with jewels.

analyzed: sarit tīra gatam kṛṣṇam bhagna arjunam atha āhvayat
translated: Then he called Krishna, who was on the river bank, and Arjuna, who had broken (the cart),

original: rāmaṃ ca rohiṇī devī krīḍantaṃ bālakair bhṛśam
analyzed: rāmam ca rohiṇī devī krīḍantam bālakaiḥ bhṛśam
translated: And the goddess Rohini called Rama, who was playing very much with the boys,

analyzed: na upeyātām yadā āhūtau krīḍā saṅgena putrakau
translated: The two sons, when called, do not come, being attached to play.

analyzed: yaśodām preṣayām āsa rohiṇī putra vatsalām
translated: Rohini, who loved her son, sent Yashoda (to call them).

original: krīḍantaṃ sā sutaṃ bālair ativelaṃ sahāgrajam
analyzed: krīḍantam sā sutam bālaiḥ ativelam saha agrajam
translated: She saw her son playing with the boys and his elder brother for a long time.

analyzed: yaśodā ajohavīt kṛṣṇam putra sneha snuta stanī
translated: Yashoda, with her breasts flowing with affection for her son, called Krishna.

original: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇāravindākṣa tāta ehi stanaṃ piba
analyzed: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa aravinda akṣa tāta ehi stanam piba
translated: Krishna, Krishna, O lotus-eyed one, father, come and drink milk.

analyzed: alam vihāraiḥ kṣudh kṣāntaḥ krīḍā śrāntaḥ si putraka
translated: Enough of playing, O son, you are hungry and tired from playing.

analyzed: he rāma āgaccha tāta āśu sa anujaḥ kula nandana
translated: Come quickly, O Rama, O son, along with your younger brother, O delighter of the family.

original: prātar eva kṛtāhāras tad bhavān bhoktum arhati
analyzed: prātar eva kṛta āhāraḥ tat bhavān bhoktum arhati
translated: Having eaten in the morning itself, you deserve to eat now.

analyzed: pratīkṣate tvām dāśārha bhokṣyamāṇaḥ vraja adhipaḥ
translated: The lord of Vraja, Dasharha, is waiting for you, desiring to eat.

original: ehy āvayoḥ priyaṃ dhehi svagṛhān yāta bālakāḥ
analyzed: ehi āvayoḥ priyam dhehi sva gṛhān yāta bālakāḥ
translated: Come and do what is dear to us. Go to your own homes, O boys.

analyzed: dhūli dhūsarita aṅgaḥ tvam putra majjanam āvaha
translated: O son, your body is covered with dust. Bring about a bath.

original: janmarkṣaṃ te 'dya bhavati viprebhyo dehi gāḥ śuciḥ
analyzed: janma ṛkṣam te dya bhavati viprebhyaḥ dehi gāḥ śuciḥ
translated: Today is your birth star. Give cows to the Brahmins, being pure.

original: paśya paśya vayasyāṃs te mātṛmṛṣṭān svalaṅkṛtān
analyzed: paśya paśya vayasyān te mātṛ mṛṣṭān su alaṅkṛtān
translated: See, see, your friends, well-groomed and adorned, have been rubbed by their mothers.

original: tvaṃ ca snātaḥ kṛtāhāro viharasva svalaṅkṛtaḥ
analyzed: tvam ca snātaḥ kṛta āhāraḥ viharasva su alaṅkṛtaḥ
translated: You, having bathed and eaten, enjoy, being well-adorned.

original: itthaṃ yaśodā tam aśeṣaśekharaṃ matvā sutaṃ snehanibaddhadhīr nṛpa

analyzed: asya api deva vapuṣaḥ mad anugrahasya sva icchā mayasya na tu bhūta mayasya kaḥ pi
translated: O Lord, no one except you can fathom the greatness of this form of yours, which is self-willed and not composed of elements, and which is the object of my grace.

original: neśe mahi tv avasituṃ manasāntareṇa sākṣāt tavaiva kim utātmasukhānubhūteḥ
analyzed: nā īśe tu avasitum manasā antareṇa sākṣāt tava eva kim uta ātma sukha anubhūteḥ
translated: What to speak of those who experience the bliss of the Self?

original: jñāne prayāsam udapāsya namanta eva🔽jīvanti sanmukharitāṃ bhavadīyavārtām
analyzed: jñāne prayāsam udapāsya namante eva  jīvanti sat mukharitām bhavadīya vārtām
translated: Those who have given up the effort in knowledge and simply bow down,🔽they live with the news of you proclaimed in their presence.

original: sthāne sthitāḥ śrutigatāṃ tanuvāṅmanobhir🔽ye prāyaśo 'jita jito 'py asi tais trilokyām
analyzed: sthāne sthitāḥ śruti gatām tanu vāc manobhiḥ  ye prāyaśas jita jitaḥ pi asi taiḥ trilokyām
translated: Those who are in their proper place, with their ears, body, speech and mind,🔽they are mostly victorious, O unconquered one, even in the three worlds.

analyzed: śreyaḥ sṛtim bhaktim udasya te vibho
translated: O Lord, those who abandon devotion, which is the path to the highest good,

analyzed: kliśyanti ye kevala bodha labdhaye
translated: and strive only for the attainment of knowledge,

analyzed: teṣām asau kleśalaḥ eva śiṣyate
translated: for them that very striving remains,

analyzed: na anyat yathā sthūla tuṣa avaghātinām
translated: like those who thresh the thick husks.

original: pureha bhūman bahavo 'pi yoginas tvadarpitehā nijakarmalabdhayā
analyzed: purā iha bhūman yoginaḥ tvad arpita īhāḥ nija karma labdhayā
translated: O Lord, in the past, many yogis also, having attained their own position by their own actions,

original: vibudhya bhaktyaiva kathopanītayā prapedire 'ñjo 'cyuta te gatiṃ parām
analyzed: vibudhya bhaktyā eva kathā upanītayā prapedire ñjo cyuta te gatim parām
translated: having awakened by devotion alone, brought by the story, they attained the highest goal, O Acyuta.

original: tathāpi bhūman mahimāguṇasya te viboddhum arhaty amalāntarātmabhiḥ
analyzed: tathā api bhūman mahimā guṇasya te viboddhum arhati amala antarātmabhiḥ
translated: Still, O Lord, your greatness can be understood only by those with pure inner souls.

original: avikriyāt svānubhavād arūpato hy ananyabodhyātmatayā na cānyathā
analyzed: avikriyāt sva anubhavāt arūpataḥ hi ananya bodhya ātmatayā na ca anyathā
translated: Not from your own experience, not from form, not otherwise, not to be known by another, not from the nature of the self,

original: guṇātmanas te 'pi guṇān vimātuṃ hitāvatīṛnasya ka īśire 'sya
analyzed: guṇa ātmanaḥ te pi guṇān vimātum ke īśire sya
translated: Even they, the qualities, were not able to measure the qualities of you, the one whose essence is the qualities, who is for the benefit of all.

original: kālena yair vā vimitāḥ sukalpair bhūpāṃśavaḥ khe mihikā dyubhāsaḥ
analyzed: kālena yaiḥ vā vimitāḥ su kalpaiḥ bhūpa aṃśavaḥ khe mihikāḥ div bhāsaḥ
translated: By whom the parts of the earth, the mist, and the light of the sky were measured in good kalpas by time,

original: tat te 'nukampāṃ susamīkṣamāṇo bhuñjāna evātmakṛtaṃ vipākam
analyzed: tat te nukampām su samīkṣamāṇaḥ bhuñjānaḥ eva ātma kṛtam vipākam
translated: Seeing your compassion well, he who lives enjoying only the ripening of his own deeds,

original: hṛdvāgvapurbhir vidadhan namas te jīveta yo muktipade sa dāyabhāk
analyzed: hṛd vāc vapurbhiḥ vidadhan namaḥ te jīveta yaḥ mukti pade sa dāya bhāj
translated: With mind, speech and body making salutations to you, he lives as one who has a share in the state of liberation.

original: paśyeśa me 'nāryam ananta ādye parātmani tvayy api māyimāyini
analyzed: paśya īśa me nāryam anante ādye parātmani tvayi api māyi māyini
translated: O Lord, see my ignoble act, in you, the endless, the primordial, the supreme self, even in you, the magician of magic.

original: māyāṃ vitatyekṣitum ātmavaibhavaṃ hy ahaṃ kiyān aiccham ivārcir agnau
analyzed: māyām vitatya īkṣitum ātma vaibhavam hi aham kiyān aiccham iva arciḥ agnau
translated: Having spread out the illusion, I desired as if to see my own glory, like a spark in a fire.

original: ataḥ kṣamasvācyuta me rajobhuvo hy ajānatas tvatpṛthagīśamāninaḥ
analyzed: atas kṣamasva acyuta me rajaḥ bhuvaḥ hi a jānataḥ tvad pṛthak īśa māninaḥ
translated: Therefore, O Achyuta, forgive me, who am born of rajas, who do not know you as separate, who am proud of my lordship.

analyzed: eṣaḥ nu kampyaḥ mayi nāthavān iti  kva aham tamaḥ mahat aham kha cara agni vārbhū  saṃveṣṭita aṇḍa ghaṭa sapta vitasti kāyaḥ
translated: I am to be pitied, O Lord, my eyes blinded by the darkness of pride in my birth, thinking I am the master here.🔽Where am I, my body wrapped in the egg of the seven worlds of darkness, Mahat, ego, air, fire, water and earth,

analyzed: kva īdṛgvidhā vigaṇita aṇḍa para aṇu caryā
translated: And where is the conduct of the atoms beyond the eggs of such kinds, not counted?

analyzed: vāta adhva roma vivarasya ca te mahi tvam
translated: And the greatness of the pores of your body, which are the sacrificial fires,

original: utkṣepaṇaṃ garbhagatasya pādayoḥ kiṃ kalpate mātur adhokṣajāgase
analyzed: utkṣepaṇam garbha gatasya pādayoḥ kim kalpate mātuḥ adhokṣaja āgase
translated: Is it possible to lift up the feet of the unborn one dwelling in the womb? What is the use of the mother's lower part?

original: kim astināstivyapadeśabhūṣitaṃ tavāsti kukṣeḥ kiyad apy anantaḥ
analyzed: kim asti nāsti vyapadeśa bhūṣitam tava asti kukṣeḥ kiyat api anantaḥ
translated: O infinite one, is there anything in your belly adorned with the designations of existence and non-existence?
The lotus-navel of Narayana, from which the unborn one emerged, is the ocean that floods the ends of the three worlds.

original: vinirgato 'jas tv iti vāṅ na vai mṛṣā kintv īśvara tvan na vinirgato 'smi
analyzed: vinirgataḥ jaḥ tu iti vāc na vai mṛṣā kintu īśvara tvat na smi
translated: The statement that the unborn one emerged from that is not false, but I did not emerge from you, O Lord.

original: nārāyaṇas tvaṃ na hi sarvadehinām ātmāsy adhīśākhilalokasākṣī
analyzed: nārāyaṇaḥ tvam na hi sarva dehinām ātmā asi adhīśa akhila loka sākṣī
translated: You are Narayana, not the soul of all embodied beings, the ruler, the witness of all worlds.

original: nārāyaṇo 'ṅgaṃ narabhūjalāyanāt tac cāpi satyaṃ na tavaiva māyā
analyzed: nārāyaṇaḥ ṅgam nara bhū jalāyanāt tat ca api satyam na tava eva māyā
translated: Narayana is a part of you, because of the human birth in water. That too is true, but it is not your Maya.

original: tac cej jalasthaṃ tava saj jagadvapuḥ
analyzed: tat ced jala stham tava sat jagat vapuḥ
translated: And if that pure world-form of yours was in the water,

original: kiṃ me na dṛṣṭaṃ bhagavaṃs tadaiva
analyzed: kim me na dṛṣṭam bhagavan tadā eva
translated: Why was it not seen by me then, O Lord?

original: kiṃ vā sudṛṣṭaṃ hṛdi me tadaiva
analyzed: kim vā su dṛṣṭam hṛdi me tadā eva
translated: Or was it seen very well by me in the heart then?

original: kiṃ no sapady eva punar vyadarśi🔽atraiva māyādhamanāvatāre hy asya prapañcasya bahiḥ sphuṭasya
analyzed: kim no sapadi eva punar vyadarśi  atrā eva māyā dhamana avatāre hi asya prapañcasya bahis sphuṭasya
translated: Why did it not appear to me at once?🔽In this very incarnation for the destruction of Maya, of this manifest universe,

original: kṛtsnasya cāntar jaṭhare jananyā māyātvam eva prakaṭīkṛtaṃ te
analyzed: kṛtsnasya ca antar jaṭhare jananyāḥ māyā tvam eva prakaṭīkṛtam te
translated: The entire universe was made manifest as your Maya in the womb of the mother.

original: yasya kukṣāv idaṃ sarvaṃ sātmaṃ bhāti yathā tathā
analyzed: yasya kukṣau idam sarvam sa ātmam bhāti yathā tathā
translated: In whose belly all this universe shines forth as if it were one's own self,

original: tat tvayy apīha tat sarvaṃ kim idaṃ māyayā vinā
analyzed: tat tvayi api iha tat sarvam kim idam māyayā vinā
translated: That all is in you here, what is this without illusion?

original: adyaiva tvad ṛte 'sya kiṃ mama na te māyātvam ādarśitam
analyzed: adyā eva tvat ṛte sya kim mama na te māyā tvam ādarśitam
translated: Today itself, without you, has not your illusory nature been shown to me?

original: eko 'si prathamaṃ tato vrajasuhṛdvatsāḥ samastā api
analyzed: ekaḥ si prathamam tatas vraja suhṛd vatsāḥ samastāḥ api
translated: You are one in the beginning, then like the cowherd's friends, all the calves,

original: tāvanto 'si caturbhujās tad akhilaiḥ sākaṃ mayopāsitās
analyzed: tāvantaḥ si catur bhujāḥ tat akhilaiḥ sākam mayā upāsitāḥ
translated: You are as many with four arms, all of them are worshipped by me together,

original: tāvanty eva jaganty abhūs tad amitaṃ brahmādvayaṃ śiṣyate
analyzed: tāvanti eva jaganti abhūḥ tat amitam brahma advayam śiṣyate
translated: You are as many worlds, that infinite non-dual Brahman remains.

original: ajānatāṃ tvatpadavīm anātmany ātmātmanā bhāsi vitatya māyām
analyzed: a jānatām tvad padavīm anātmani ātma ātmanā bhāsi vitatya māyām
translated: To those who do not know your path, in the non-self, you shine as the self by yourself, spreading out illusion.

original: sṛṣṭāv ivāhaṃ jagato vidhāna iva tvam eṣo 'nta iva trinetraḥ
analyzed: sṛṣṭau iva aham jagataḥ vidhāne iva tvam eṣaḥ nte iva trinetraḥ
translated: As if in creation, I am like the arrangement of the world, you are like the end, like the three-eyed one,

original: sureṣv ṛṣiṣv īśa tathaiva nṛṣv api tiryakṣu yādaḥsv api te 'janasya
analyzed: sureṣu ṛṣiṣu īśa tathā eva nṛṣu api tiryakṣu yādaḥsu api te janasya
translated: O Lord, in the same way among the gods, sages, and men, even among animals and demons, you have no birth.

original: janmāsatāṃ durmadanigrahāya prabho vidhātaḥ sadanugrahāya ca
analyzed: janma asatām durmada nigrahāya prabho vidhātar sat anugrahāya ca
translated: For the subjugation of the arrogant and for the protection of the good, O Lord, you create birth and non-existence.

original: ko vetti bhūman bhagavan parātman yogeśvarotīr bhavatas trilokyām
analyzed: kaḥ vetti bhūman bhagavan parātman yogeśvara ūtīḥ bhavataḥ trilokyām
translated: Who knows, O Lord, O Supreme Self, O master of yoga, in the three worlds,

original: kva vā kathaṃ vā kati vā kadeti vistārayan krīḍasi yogamāyām
analyzed: kva vā katham vā kati vā kadā iti vistārayan krīḍasi yogamāyām
translated: Where or how or how many or when, spreading out, you play with your yogic illusion?

analyzed: tasmāt idam jagat aśeṣam asat svarūpam
translated: Therefore, this entire world, of unreal nature,

analyzed: svapna ābham asta dhiṣaṇam puru duḥkha duḥkham
translated: like a dream, devoid of true understanding, full of great suffering and misery,

analyzed: tvayi eva nitya sukha bodha tanau anante
translated: in You alone, who are of eternal bliss and knowledge, infinite,

original: māyāta udyad api yat sad ivāvabhāti
analyzed: māyātaḥ udyat api yat sat iva avabhāti
translated: though arisen from Maya, appears as if real.

original: ekas tvam ātmā puruṣaḥ purāṇaḥ satyaḥ svayaṃjyotir ananta ādyaḥ
analyzed: ekaḥ tvam ātmā puruṣaḥ purāṇaḥ satyaḥ svayam jyotiḥ anantaḥ ādyaḥ
translated: You are the one Self, the Purusha, the ancient, true, self-luminous, infinite, primordial,
eternal, imperishable, ever-blissful, unstained, complete, non-dual, liberated from limiting adjuncts, immortal.

original: evaṃvidhaṃ tvāṃ sakalātmanām api svātmānam ātmātmatayā vicakṣate
analyzed: evaṃvidham tvām sakala ātmanām api sva ātmānam ātma ātma tayā vicakṣate
translated: They regard You, who are of such nature, as their own Self, the Self of all, by considering You as their own Self.

analyzed: guru arka labdha upaniṣad su cakṣuṣā ye te taranti iva bhava anṛta ambudhim
translated: Those who, by the eye of the Upanishads obtained from the sun-like Guru, seem to cross the ocean of worldly existence,

original: ātmānam evātmatayāvijānatāṃ tenaiva jātaṃ nikhilaṃ prapañcitam
analyzed: ātmānam eva ātma tayā avijānatām tena eva jātam nikhilam prapañcitam
translated: To those who do not know the Self as the Self, everything is produced by that very Self.

original: jñānena bhūyo 'pi ca tat pralīyate rajjvām aher bhogabhavābhavau yathā
analyzed: jñānena ca tat pralīyate rajjvām aheḥ bhoga bhava abhavau yathā
translated: By knowledge, it again dissolves, like the existence and non-existence of the snake on the rope.

original: ajñānasaṃjñau bhavabandhamokṣau dvau nāma nānyau sta ṛtajñabhāvāt
analyzed: ajñāna saṃjñau bhava bandha mokṣau dvau nāma na anyau staḥ ṛta jña bhāvāt
translated: Bondage and liberation, known as ignorance, are two names, there is nothing else, due to the nature of knowing the truth.

original: ajasracity ātmani kevale pare vicāryamāṇe taraṇāv ivāhanī
analyzed: ajasra citi ātmani kevale pare vicāryamāṇe taraṇau iva ahanī
translated: When the eternal, pure Self, the supreme, is being pondered, it is like a boat in the ocean of worldly existence.

original: tvām ātmānaṃ paraṃ matvā param ātmānam eva ca
analyzed: tvām ātmānam param matvā param ātmānam eva ca
translated: Considering you as the supreme Self and the supreme Self as yourself,

original: ātmā punar bahir mṛgya aho 'jñajanatājñatā🔽antarbhave 'nanta bhavantam eva hy atat tyajanto mṛgayanti santaḥ
analyzed: ātmā punar bahis mṛgya aho jña jana tā ajña tā  antarbhave nanta bhavantam eva hi a tat tyajantaḥ mṛgayanti santaḥ
translated: The Self is again sought externally - alas! The ignorance of the ignorant!🔽O infinite one, the wise ones, not finding you within, seek you outside, abandoning that which is not you.

original: asantam apy anty ahim antareṇa santaṃ guṇaṃ taṃ kim u yanti santaḥ
analyzed: asantam api anti ahim antareṇa santam guṇam tam kim u yanti santaḥ
translated: Do the wise ones seek the existent, the quality within, even though the serpent within is nonexistent?

original: athāpi te deva padāmbujadvaya prasādaleśānugṛhīta eva hi
analyzed: atha api te deva pada ambuja dvaya prasāda leśa anugṛhītaḥ eva hi
translated: O Lord, it is only one who is graced with a small portion of the favor of your lotus feet

original: jānāti tattvaṃ bhagavanmahimno na cānya eko 'pi ciraṃ vicinvan
analyzed: jānāti tattvam bhagavat mahimnaḥ na ca anyaḥ ekaḥ ciram vicinvan
translated: Knows the truth of the greatness of the Lord, and no one else, even if searching for a long time.

original: tad astu me nātha sa bhūribhāgo bhave 'tra vānyatra tu vā tiraścām
analyzed: tat astu me nātha sa bhūri bhāgaḥ bhave vā anyatra tu vā tiraścām
translated: Let that be my great fortune, O Lord, whether here or elsewhere, even as an animal,

original: yenāham eko 'pi bhavajjanānāṃ bhūtvā niṣeve tava pādapallavam🔽aho 'tidhanyā vrajagoramaṇyaḥ stanyāmṛtaṃ pītam atīva te mudā
analyzed: yena aham ekaḥ bhavat janānām bhūtvā niṣeve tava pāda pallavam  aho ti dhanyāḥ vraja goramaṇyaḥ stanya amṛtam pītam atīva te mudā
translated: So that I too may become one of your devotees and serve your lotus feet.🔽Oh, how fortunate are the beautiful cowherdesses of Vraja, who joyfully drank the nectar of your milk!

original: yāsāṃ vibho vatsatarātmajātmanā yattṛptaye 'dyāpi na cālam adhvarāḥ
analyzed: yāsām vibho vatsatara ātmaja ātmanā yad tṛptaye dyā api na ca alam adhvarāḥ
translated: O Lord, their desires are not yet satisfied, even now, by the sacrifices performed by the sons of the cowherd women.

analyzed: aho bhāgyam aho bhāgyam nanda gopa vraja okasām
translated: Oh, what fortune! Oh, what fortune! Of the cowherds and residents of Vraja!

analyzed: yat mitram parama ānandam pūrṇam brahma sanātanam
translated: That their friend is the supreme bliss, the complete and eternal Brahman,

analyzed: eṣām tu bhāgya mahimā acyuta tāvat āstām
translated: O Acyuta, let us leave aside for now the greatness of their good fortune,

original: ekādaśaiva hi vayaṃ bata bhūribhāgāḥ🔽etaddhṛṣīkacaṣakair asakṛt pibāmaḥ
analyzed: ekādaśa eva hi vayam bata bhūri bhāgāḥ  etat hṛṣīka caṣakaiḥ asakṛt pibāmaḥ
translated: for we are indeed the most fortunate ones, being eleven in number.🔽We repeatedly drink this nectar-like essence born from your feet,

analyzed: śarva ādayaḥ ṅghri udaja madhu amṛta āsavam te
translated: O Sharva and others, through the cups of our ears.

original: tad bhūribhāgyam iha janma kim apy aṭavyāṃ
analyzed: tat bhūri bhāgyam iha janma kim api aṭavyām
translated: What is this great good fortune here, to be born in a forest,

analyzed: yat gokule katama aṅghri rajaḥ abhiṣekam
translated: where even in Gokula, some are anointed with the dust from your feet?

analyzed: yat jīvitam tu nikhilam bhagavān mukundaḥ
translated: If the entire life is devoted to Lord Mukunda,

original: tv adyāpi yatpadarajaḥ śrutimṛgyam eva🔽eṣāṃ ghoṣanivāsinām uta bhavān kiṃ deva rāteti naś
analyzed: tu adyā api yad pada rajaḥ śruti mṛgyam eva  eṣām ghoṣa nivāsinām uta bhavān kim deva rāta iti naḥ
translated: and even now, his foot-dust is to be sought by the ears,

original: ceto viśvaphalāt phalaṃ tvadaparaṃ kutrāpy ayan muhyati
analyzed: cetaḥ viśva phalāt phalam tvad aparam kutra api ayat muhyati
translated: O God, our mind, which has attained the fruit of all desires, is confused as to where else to go, thinking, Is it you who are bestowed upon us, the residents of Gokula?

original: sadveṣād iva pūtanāpi sakulā tvām eva devāpitā
analyzed: sa dveṣāt iva pūtanā api sa kulā tvām eva devā pitā
translated: As if out of hatred for the good, Pūtanā, along with her relatives, has brought you, the protector of gods, to her own house.

analyzed: yad dhāma artha suhṛd priya ātma tanaya prāṇa āśayāḥ tvad kṛte
translated: For your sake, wealth, friends, loved ones, body, and life

original: tāvad rāgādayaḥ stenās tāvat kārāgṛhaṃ gṛham
analyzed: tāvat rāga ādayaḥ stenāḥ tāvat kārāgṛham gṛham
translated: are all stolen by attachment and other [passions], the house is a prison,

original: tāvan moho 'ṅghrinigaḍo yāvat kṛṣṇa na te janāḥ
analyzed: tāvat mohaḥ ṅghri nigaḍaḥ yāvat kṛṣṇa na te janāḥ
translated: delusion is the fetter on the feet, as long as one is not your devotee, O Krishna.

analyzed: prapañcam viḍambayasi bhū tale
translated: Even though you are free from conceptual elaboration, you imitate conceptual elaboration on the earth.

analyzed: prapanna janatā ānanda sandoham prathitum prabho
translated: O Lord, in order to spread the joy of the multitude of devotees who have taken refuge in you,

original: jānanta eva jānantu kiṃ bahūktyā na me prabho
analyzed: jānantaḥ eva jānantu kim bahu uktyā na me prabho
translated: Even if they know, let them know. What is the use of speaking much? O Lord,

original: manaso vapuṣo vāco vaibhavaṃ tava gocaraḥ
analyzed: manasaḥ vapuṣaḥ vācaḥ vaibhavam tava gocaraḥ
translated: The glory of your mind, body and speech is not within my reach.

original: anujānīhi māṃ kṛṣṇa sarvaṃ tvaṃ vetsi sarvadṛk
analyzed: anujānīhi mām kṛṣṇa sarvam tvam vetsi sarva dṛś
translated: O Krishna, grant me permission. You alone are all-seeing.

original: tvam eva jagatāṃ nātho jagad etat tavārpitam🔽śrīkṛṣṇa vṛṣṇikulapuṣkarajoṣadāyin
analyzed: tvam eva jagatām nāthaḥ jagat etat tava arpitam
translated: You alone are the lord of the worlds. This universe is offered to you.🔽O Krishna, the best of the Vrishni clan, the giver of happiness,
The one who increases the cows, Brahmins, animals and prosperity on earth,
The remover of the burden of Dharma, the destroyer of the demons on earth,

original: ākalpam ārkam arhan bhagavan namas te
analyzed: ā kalpam ārkam arhan bhagavan namaḥ te
translated: For as long as the sun shines, O Blessed One, I bow to you.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Shukadeva Gosvami said:

original: ity abhiṣṭūya bhūmānaṃ triḥ parikramya pādayoḥ
analyzed: iti abhiṣṭūya bhūmānam tris parikramya pādayoḥ
translated: Having thus praised the Supreme Lord, circumambulating Him three times,

analyzed: natvā abhīṣṭam jagaddhātā sva dhāma pratyapadyata
translated: Bowing at His feet, the sustainer of the universe returned to His own abode.

analyzed: tatas nujñāpya bhagavān sva bhuvam prāk avasthitān
translated: Then the Blessed Lord, having taken leave of His own people who were staying in their original places,

translated: As if an ancient man was worshipped with flowers here.🔽O king, with a thousand hoods agitated by his wonderful dance,

analyzed: raktam mukhaiḥ uru vaman nṛpa bhagna gātraḥ  smṛtvā carācara gurum puruṣam purāṇam

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ahim ādyam upaseduḥ amuṣya patnya

translated: the wives of that serpent approached, distressed, with their garments, ornaments and hair loosened.

analyzed: kāyam nidhāya bhuvi bhūtapatim praṇemuḥ  sādhvyaḥ kṛta añjali puṭāḥ śamalasya bhartuḥ

analyzed: nāga patnyaḥ ūcuḥ

analyzed: tava avatāraḥ khala nigrahāya

analyzed: ripoḥ sutānām api tulya dṛṣṭiḥ
translated: You have equal vision towards the sons of your enemy,

analyzed: dhatse damam phalam eva anuśaṃsan
translated: imposing restraint, considering the fruit itself as the benefit.

original: anugraho 'yaṃ bhavataḥ kṛto hi no daṇḍo 'satāṃ te khalu kalmaṣāpahaḥ
analyzed: anugrahaḥ yam bhavataḥ kṛtaḥ hi naḥ satām te khalu kalmaṣa apahaḥ

analyzed: triguṇena abhimānena gūḍha sva ātma anubhūtaye

analyzed: namaḥ nantāya sūkṣmāya kūṭasthāya vipaścite

analyzed: namaḥ kṛṣṇāya rāmāya vasudeva sutāya ca

analyzed: guṇa vṛtti upalakṣyāya guṇa draṣṭre sva saṃvide

analyzed: avyākṛta vihārāya sarva vyākṛta siddhaye

translated: On each parva day, the serpents give their own shares,

translated: If Garuḍa enters here and eats the fish,

analyzed: pitā guruḥ tvam jagatām adhīśaḥ duratyayaḥ kālaḥ upātta daṇḍaḥ

analyzed: mayā idam bhagavan goṣṭha nāśāya asāra vāyubhiḥ

original: suratavardhanaṃ śokanāśanaṃ svaritaveṇunā suṣṭhu cumbitam🔽itararāgavismāraṇaṃ nṛṇāṃ vitara vīra nas te 'dharāmṛtam
analyzed: surata vardhanam śoka nāśanam svarita veṇunā suṣṭhu cumbitam  itara rāga vismāraṇam nṛṇām vitara vīra naḥ te dharā amṛtam
translated: Your lips, which increase passion and destroy sorrow, are well kissed by the sweet flute.🔽O hero, please distribute the nectar of Your lips, which makes men forget all other attachments.

original: aṭati yad bhavān ahni kānanaṃ truṭi yugāyate tvām apaśyatām🔽kuṭilakuntalaṃ śrīmukhaṃ ca te jaḍa udīkṣatāṃ pakṣmakṛd dṛśām
analyzed: aṭati yat bhavān ahni kānanam truṭi yugāyate tvām apaśyatām  kuṭila kuntalam śrī mukham ca te jaḍaḥ udīkṣatām pakṣma kṛt dṛśām
translated: When You wander in the forest during the day, even a moment seems like a yuga to those who cannot see You.🔽The eyelashes of those who gaze at Your curly locks and beautiful face become motionless.

analyzed: pati suta anvaya bhrātṛ bāndhavān ati vilaṅghya te acyuta āgatāḥ
translated: O Acyuta, they have come to You, having completely abandoned their husbands, sons, relatives, and brothers.

original: gatividas tavodgītamohitāḥ kitava yoṣitaḥ kas tyajen niśi🔽rahasi saṃvidaṃ hṛcchayodayaṃ prahasitānanaṃ premavīkṣaṇam
analyzed: gati vidaḥ tava udgīta mohitāḥ kitava yoṣitaḥ kaḥ tyajet niśi  rahasi saṃvidam hṛcchaya udayam prahasita ānanam prema vīkṣaṇam
translated: O gambler, who would abandon at night the women who are enchanted by Your songs, which are the source of knowledge of the spiritual world?🔽The laughter on Your face, the loving glances, the rising of passion in the heart during secret conversation,

original: bṛhaduraḥ śriyo vīkṣya dhāma te muhur atispṛhā muhyate manaḥ
analyzed: bṛhat uraḥ śriyaḥ vīkṣya dhāma te muhur ati spṛhāḥ muhyate manaḥ
translated: again and again seeing Your broad chest, the abode of Śrī, my mind becomes bewildered with intense longing.

original: vrajavanaukasāṃ vyaktir aṅga te vṛjinahantry alaṃ viśvamaṅgalam
analyzed: vraja vanaukasām vyaktiḥ aṅga te vṛjina hantri alam viśva maṅgalam
translated: O destroyer of troubles, You are the manifest form of the people of Vṛndāvana's forest, the all-auspicious one.

original: tyaja manāk ca nas tvatspṛhātmanāṃ svajanahṛdrujāṃ yan niṣūdanam
analyzed: tyaja manāk ca naḥ tvad spṛhā ātmanām sva jana hṛd rujām yat niṣūdanam
translated: Please do not abandon us, whose minds are filled with longing for You, for You are the destroyer of the heart's distress of Your relatives.

analyzed: yat te sujāta caraṇa amburuham staneṣu
translated: Your lotus feet, O Well-Born One, on our breasts,🔽

analyzed: bhītāḥ śanais priya dadhīmahi karkaśeṣu
translated: O dear one, we are afraid to place your lotus feet, born of good birth, on our hard breasts.

original: tenāṭavīm aṭasi tad vyathate na kiṃ svit
analyzed: tena aṭavīm aṭasi tat vyathate na kim svid
translated: For that reason, you wander in the forest. Does it not pain you?

analyzed: kūrpa ādibhiḥ bhramati dhīḥ bhavat āyuṣām naḥ
translated: Our minds are confused by the deer and other animals. Does your life not wander?

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

original: iti gopyaḥ pragāyantyaḥ pralapantyaś ca citradhā
analyzed: iti gopyaḥ pragāyantyaḥ pralapantyaḥ ca citradhā
translated: O king, the gopīs sang in this way, spoke in various ways,

original: ruruduḥ susvaraṃ rājan kṛṣṇadarśanalālasāḥ🔽tāsām āvirabhūc chauriḥ smayamānamukhāmbujaḥ🔽pītāmbaradharaḥ sragvī sākṣān manmathamanmathaḥ
analyzed: ruruduḥ su svaram rājan kṛṣṇa darśana lālasāḥ  tāsām āvirabhūt śauriḥ smayamāna mukha ambujaḥ
translated: and wept melodiously, longing to see Kṛṣṇa.🔽Śauri appeared to them, his lotus face smiling,🔽wearing yellow garments, a garland, and directly the destroyer of Cupid.

analyzed: tam vilokya āgatam preṣṭham prīti utphulla dṛśaḥ balāḥ
translated: Seeing their beloved come, the young women's eyes blossomed with joy.

original: uttasthur yugapat sarvās tanvaḥ prāṇam ivāgatam
analyzed: uttasthuḥ yugapad sarvāḥ tanvaḥ prāṇam iva āgatam
translated: All of them stood up at once, as if their life had returned.

original: kācit karāmbujaṃ śaurer jagṛhe 'ñjalinā mudā🔽kācid dadhāra tadbāhum aṃse candanabhūṣitam🔽kācid añjalināgṛhṇāt tanvī tāmbūlacarvitam
analyzed: kācid kara ambujam śaureḥ jagṛhe ñjalinā mudā  kācid dadhāra tad bāhum aṃse candana bhūṣitam  kācid añjalinā agṛhṇāt tanvī tāmbūla carvitam
translated: One joyfully took Śauri's lotus hand in her folded palms.🔽One held his arm, adorned with sandalwood paste, on her shoulder.

analyzed: ekā tad aṅghri kamalam santaptā stanayoḥ adhāt
translated: One slender one took in her folded palms the chewed betel nut.🔽One, burning with passion, placed his lotus foot on her breasts.

analyzed: ekā bhrukuṭim ābadhya prema saṃrambha vihvalā
translated: One, agitated with love and excitement, knitted her eyebrows.

analyzed: ghnantī iva aikṣat kaṭa ākṣepaiḥ sandaṣṭa daśanacchadā
translated: She seemed to kill him with sidelong glances, with lips biting her teeth.

analyzed: aparā nimiṣat dṛgbhyām juṣāṇā tad mukha ambujam
translated: Enjoying that lotus face with eyes not closing,

original: āpītam api nātṛpyat santas taccaraṇaṃ yathā🔽taṃ kācin netrarandhreṇa hṛdi kṛtvā nimīlya ca
analyzed: āpītam api na atṛpyat santaḥ tad caraṇam yathā  tam kācid netra randhreṇa hṛdi kṛtvā nimīlya ca
translated: She did not become satisfied, as the good do not with his feet.🔽One of them, placing him in her eye-cavity, closing it,

analyzed: pulaka aṅgī upaguhya āste yogī iva ānanda samplutā
translated: Embraced him with her body full of horripilation, as if in meditation, overflowing with bliss.

analyzed: sarvāḥ tāḥ keśava āloka parama utsava nirvṛtāḥ
translated: All of them, delighted with the festival of seeing Keshava,

original: jahur virahajaṃ tāpaṃ prājñaṃ prāpya yathā janāḥ
analyzed: jahuḥ viraha jam tāpam prājñam prāpya yathā janāḥ
translated: Gave up the grief born of separation, as people do on obtaining a wise one.

analyzed: tābhiḥ vidhūta śokābhiḥ bhagavān acyutaḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: The Lord Achyuta, surrounded by them who had dispelled their sorrow,

analyzed: vyarocata adhikam tāta puruṣaḥ śaktibhiḥ yathā
translated: Shone forth more than before, O son, like a man with his powers.

original: tāḥ samādāya kālindyā nirviśya pulinaṃ vibhuḥ🔽vikasatkundamandāra surabhyanilaṣaṭpadam🔽śaraccandrāṃśusandoha dhvastadoṣātamaḥ śivam
analyzed: tāḥ samādāya kālindyāḥ nirviśya pulinam vibhuḥ  vikasat kunda mandāra surabhi anila ṣaṭpadam  śarad candra aṃśu sandoha dhvasta doṣā tamaḥ śivam
translated: Taking them, the Lord crossed to the bank of the Yamuna,🔽Fragrant with blooming jasmine and mandara flowers, with bees,🔽The auspicious darkness of faults dispelled by the mass of autumn moonbeams,

analyzed: kṛṣṇāyāḥ hasta taralā cita komala vālukam
translated: The soft sand moving with Krishna's hand,

analyzed: tad darśana āhlāda vidhūta hṛdrujaḥ manoratha antam śrutayaḥ yathā yayuḥ
translated: Their hearts' pain dispelled by the joy of seeing him, the Vedas went to the end of their desire,

original: svair uttarīyaiḥ kucakuṅkumāṅkitair acīkḷpann āsanam ātmabandhave
analyzed: svaiḥ uttarīyaiḥ kuca kuṅkuma aṅkitaiḥ acīkḷpan āsanam ātmabandhave
translated: They prepared a seat for their husband with their own upper garments marked with saffron from their breasts.

original: tatropaviṣṭo bhagavān sa īśvaro yogeśvarāntarhṛdi kalpitāsanaḥ🔽cakāsa gopīpariṣadgato 'rcitas trailokyalakṣmyekapadaṃ vapur dadhat
analyzed: tatra upaviṣṭaḥ bhagavān saḥ īśvaraḥ yogeśvara antar hṛdi kalpita āsanaḥ  cakāsa gopī pariṣad gataḥ rcitaḥ trailokya lakṣmī eka padam vapuḥ dadhat
translated: The Blessed Lord, the Supreme God, seated there, on a seat imagined in the hearts of the lords of yoga,🔽Shone forth, surrounded by the circle of gopīs, his form the sole embodiment of the glory of the three worlds, worshipped.

analyzed: sabhājayitvā tam anaṅga dīpanam sa hāsa līlā īkṣaṇa vibhrama bhruvā
translated: Having honored him, the enflamer of Ananga, with sidelong glances and playful smiles,

analyzed: saṃsparśanena aṅka kṛta aṅghri hastayoḥ saṃstutya īṣat kupitāḥ babhāṣire
translated: Having praised him by placing their feet and hands on his lap through touch, they spoke, slightly angry.

analyzed: śrī gopyaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The exalted gopīs said:

analyzed: bhajataḥ nu bhajanti ekaḥ ekaḥ etad viparyayam
translated: Some serve, some are served, some do the opposite,

original: nobhayāṃś ca bhajanty eka etan no brūhi sādhu bhoḥ
analyzed: na ubhayān ca bhajanti eke etat naḥ brūhi sādhu bhoḥ
translated: Some serve neither - please tell us this, O good one.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Supreme Lord said:

original: mitho bhajanti ye sakhyaḥ svārthaikāntodyamā hi te
analyzed: mithas bhajanti ye sakhyaḥ sva artha ekānta udyamāḥ hi te
translated: Those friends who serve each other do so only for their own selfish ends.

original: na tatra sauhṛdaṃ dharmaḥ svārthārthaṃ tad dhi nānyathā
analyzed: na tatra sauhṛdam dharmaḥ svārtha artham tat hi na anyathā
translated: There is no friendship or righteousness there, for it is for their own sake, not for any other.

original: bhajanty abhajato ye vai karuṇāḥ pitarau yathā
analyzed: bhajanti a bhajataḥ ye vai karuṇāḥ pitarau yathā
translated: But those who serve the unserving are compassionate, like parents.

analyzed: dharmaḥ sauhṛdam ca sumadhyamāḥ
translated: Here, righteousness is unquestioned, and friendship is excellent, O slender-waisted ones.

original: bhajato 'pi na vai kecid bhajanty abhajataḥ kutaḥ
analyzed: na vai kecid bhajanti a bhajataḥ kutas
translated: Even if one worships them, they do not worship him. How much less so if one does not worship them.

analyzed: ātma ārāmāḥ hi āpta kāmāḥ akṛtajñāḥ guru druhaḥ
translated: They are self-satisfied, having attained their desires. They are ungrateful and enemies of their spiritual masters.

original: nāhaṃ tu sakhyo bhajato 'pi jantūn bhajāmy amīṣām anuvṛttivṛttaye
analyzed: na aham tu sakhyaḥ jantūn bhajāmi amīṣām anuvṛtti vṛttaye
translated: O friends, I do not worship even those who worship Me, in order to make them continue to worship.

original: yathādhano labdhadhane vinaṣṭe taccintayānyan nibhṛto na veda
analyzed: yathā adhanaḥ labdha dhane vinaṣṭe tad cintayā anyat nibhṛtaḥ na veda
translated: Just as a poor man, when the wealth he has obtained is lost, does not know anything else due to thinking about it,

original: evaṃ madarthojjhitalokaveda svānām hi vo mayy anuvṛttaye 'balāḥ
analyzed: evam mad artha ujjhita loka veda svānām hi vaḥ mayi anuvṛttaye balāḥ
translated: in the same way, you who have abandoned the Vedas and the world for My sake, are powerless to continue worshipping Me.

original: mayāparokṣaṃ bhajatā tirohitaṃ māsūyituṃ mārhatha tat priyaṃ priyāḥ
analyzed: mayā aparokṣam bhajatā tirohitam mā asūyitum mā arhatha tat priyam priyāḥ
translated: I, who am worshipped by you, have disappeared. O beloveds, you should not envy that which is dear to you.

original: na pāraye 'haṃ niravadyasaṃyujāṃ svasādhukṛtyaṃ vibudhāyuṣāpi vaḥ
analyzed: na pāraye ham niravadya saṃyujām sva sādhu kṛtyam vibudha āyuṣā api vaḥ
translated: I am not able to describe your good deeds, which are free from fault, even with the lifespan of a demigod.

original: yā mābhajan durjaragehaśṛṅkhalāḥ saṃvṛścya tad vaḥ pratiyātu sādhunā
analyzed: yāḥ mā ābhajan durjara geha śṛṅkhalāḥ saṃvṛścya tat vaḥ pratiyātu sādhunā
translated: May that [goodness] which you, who are bound by the fetters of a difficult-to-digest house, did not worship, return to you as good fortune.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

original: itthaṃ bhagavato gopyaḥ śrutvā vācaḥ supeśalāḥ
analyzed: ittham bhagavataḥ gopyaḥ śrutvā vācaḥ su peśalāḥ
translated: Thus, having heard the very beautiful words of the Lord,

original: jahur virahajaṃ tāpaṃ tadaṅgopacitāśiṣaḥ🔽tatrārabhata govindo rāsakrīḍām anuvrataiḥ
analyzed: jahuḥ viraha jam tāpam tad aṅga upacita āśiṣaḥ  tatra ārabhata govindaḥ rāsakrīḍām anuvrataiḥ
translated: the gopīs gave up the distress of separation, their blessings accumulated by His touch.

analyzed: strī ratnaiḥ anvitaḥ prītaiḥ anyonya ābaddha bāhubhiḥ
translated: There, Govinda began the rāsa dance with the jewel-like women, who were devoted, delighted, and had their arms locked together.

analyzed: rāsa utsavaḥ sampravṛttaḥ gopī maṇḍala maṇḍitaḥ
translated: The festival of Rasa dance commenced, adorned with a circle of gopis.

original: yogeśvareṇa kṛṣṇena tāsāṃ madhye dvayor dvayoḥ
analyzed: yogeśvareṇa kṛṣṇena tāsām madhye dvayoḥ dvayoḥ
translated: In the midst of them, Krishna, the Lord of Yoga, entered in pairs.

analyzed: praviṣṭena gṛhītānām kaṇṭhe sva nikaṭam striyaḥ
translated: Seizing the necks of the women who were held by him, he brought them close to him.

analyzed: yam manyeran nabhaḥ tāvat vimāna śata saṅkulam
translated: As long as they would consider the sky filled with hundreds of celestial vehicles,

analyzed: divaukasām sa dārāṇām autsukya apahṛta ātmanām
translated: of the heaven-dwellers with their wives, their minds captivated by eagerness.

analyzed: tatas dundubhayaḥ neduḥ nipetuḥ puṣpa vṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Then drums were sounded, flower showers fell,

analyzed: jaguḥ gandharva patayaḥ sa strīkāḥ tat yaśaḥ malam
translated: and the chief gandharvas, along with their wives, sang his pure fame.

analyzed: valayānām nūpurāṇām kiṅkiṇīnām ca yoṣitām
translated: The sound of bracelets, anklets, and bells of the women

analyzed: sa priyāṇām abhūt śabdaḥ tumulaḥ rāsa maṇḍale
translated: with their lovers was tumultuous in the circle of the Rasa dance.

analyzed: tatra atiśuśubhe tābhiḥ bhagavān devakī sutaḥ
translated: There, the Lord, the son of Devaki, shone greatly with them,

original: madhye maṇīnāṃ haimānāṃ mahāmarakato yathā🔽pādanyāsair bhujavidhutibhiḥ sasmitair bhrūvilāsair🔽bhajyan madhyaiś calakucapaṭaiḥ kuṇḍalair gaṇḍalolaiḥ
analyzed: madhye maṇīnām haimānām mahā marakataḥ yathā  pāda nyāsaiḥ bhuja vidhutibhiḥ sa smitaiḥ bhrū vilāsaiḥ  bhajyan madhyaiḥ cala kuca paṭaiḥ kuṇḍalaiḥ gaṇḍa lolaiḥ
translated: like a large emerald in the midst of golden gems.🔽With the movements of their feet, the gestures of their arms, their smiles, the play of their eyebrows,🔽their waists bending, their loose breasts and garments, their earrings swinging,

analyzed: svid yat mukhyaḥ kavara rasanā granthayaḥ kṛṣṇa vadhvaḥ
translated: their faces perspiring, their blouses, their necklaces, and the knots of their garments, Krishna's wives

original: gāyantyas taṃ taḍita iva tā meghacakre virejuḥ
analyzed: gāyantyaḥ tam taḍitaḥ iva tāḥ megha cakre virejuḥ
translated: sang to him, and they shone like lightning in a circle of clouds.

analyzed: uccais jaguḥ nṛtyamānāḥ rakta kaṇṭhyaḥ rati priyāḥ
translated: The beloveds of Rati, with red throats, sang loudly while dancing.

analyzed: kṛṣṇa abhimarśa muditā yat gītena idam āvṛtam
translated: This world is pervaded by the singing that arose from Krishna's touch.

original: kācit samaṃ mukundena svarajātīr amiśritāḥ🔽unninye pūjitā tena prīyatā sādhu sādhv iti
analyzed: kācid samam mukundena svara jātīḥ a miśritāḥ  unninye pūjitā tena prīyatā sādhu sādhu iti
translated: One woman, honored by Mukunda, raised the unmixed svaras and jatis together with him.🔽He, being pleased, said Well done, well done to her.

original: tad eva dhruvam unninye tasyai mānaṃ ca bahv adāt🔽kācid rāsapariśrāntā pārśvasthasya gadābhṛtaḥ🔽jagrāha bāhunā skandhaṃ ślathadvalayamallikā🔽tatraikāṃsagataṃ bāhuṃ kṛṣṇasyotpalasaurabham
analyzed: tat eva dhruvam unninye tasyai mānam ca bahu adāt  kācid rāsa pariśrāntā pārśva sthasya gadābhṛtaḥ  jagrāha bāhunā skandham ślathat valaya mallikā  tatra eka aṃsa gatam bāhum kṛṣṇasya utpala saurabham
translated: He raised that very svaras and gave her much honor.🔽One, tired from the rasa dance, took the shoulder of the mace-bearing Lord standing by her side with her arm, the bracelets and jasmine flowers loose.

original: candanāliptam āghrāya hṛṣṭaromā cucumba ha🔽kasyāścin nāṭyavikṣipta kuṇḍalatviṣamaṇḍitam🔽gaṇḍaṃ gaṇḍe sandadhatyāḥ prādāt tāmbūlacarvitam
analyzed: candana āliptam āghrāya hṛṣṭa romā cucumba ha  kasyāścid nāṭya vikṣipta kuṇḍala tviṣa maṇḍitam  gaṇḍam gaṇḍe sandadhatyāḥ prādāt tāmbūla carvitam
translated: Smelling the arm of Krishna, fragrant with blue lotuses and smeared with sandalwood paste, which was resting on one shoulder, she trembled with joy and kissed it.🔽One woman, her cheek adorned with the luster of earrings scattered by her dance, put the chewed betel nut from her cheek on her cheek as she placed it there.

original: nṛtyatī gāyatī kācit kūjan nūpuramekhalā🔽pārśvasthācyutahastābjaṃ śrāntādhāt stanayoḥ śivam
analyzed: nṛtyatī gāyatī kācid kūjat nūpura mekhalā  pārśva sthā acyuta hasta abjam śrāntā adhāt stanayoḥ śivam
translated: One, dancing and singing, with jingling anklets and girdle, tired, placed the lotus hand of Achyuta on her breasts.

analyzed: gopyaḥ labdhvā acyutam kāntam śriyaḥ ekānta vallabham
translated: The gopis, having obtained Achyuta, the beloved of Shri, the sole lover,

analyzed: gṛhīta kaṇṭhyaḥ tad dorbhyām gāyantyaḥ tam vijahrire
translated: embraced by his two arms, singing, sported with him.
With the ornaments of earrings, garlands, tilaka, and forehead,

analyzed: vaktra śriyaḥ valaya nūpura ghoṣa vādyaiḥ
translated: with the music of bracelets and anklets,

analyzed: gopyaḥ samam bhagavatā nanṛtuḥ sva keśa
translated: the gopīs danced with the Lord, their flower garlands loosened,

analyzed: srasta srajaḥ bhramara gāyaka rāsa goṣṭhyām  evam pariṣvaṅga kara abhimarśa snigdha īkṣaṇa uddāma vilāsa hāsaiḥ
translated: in the cowherds' assembly, with bees singing.🔽Thus the Lord of love enjoyed with the beautiful girls of Vraja, with embraces, caresses, affectionate glances, expansive amorous laughter,

original: reme rameśo vrajasundarībhir yathārbhakaḥ svapratibimbavibhramaḥ🔽tadaṅgasaṅgapramudākulendriyāḥ keśān dukūlaṃ kucapaṭṭikāṃ vā
analyzed: reme rameśaḥ vraja sundarībhiḥ yathā arbhakaḥ sva pratibimba vibhramaḥ  tad aṅga saṅga pramudā ākula indriyāḥ keśān dukūlam kuca paṭṭikām vā
translated: like a child with the illusion of his own reflection.🔽The girls of Vraja, their senses overwhelmed with the joy of embracing His body, were unable to put on their hair, garments, or bodice, O perpetuator of the Kuru dynasty,

original: nāñjaḥ prativyoḍhum alaṃ vrajastriyo visrastamālābharaṇāḥ kurūdvaha🔽kṛṣṇavikrīḍitaṃ vīkṣya mumuhuḥ khecarastriyaḥ
analyzed: na añjas prativyoḍhum alam vraja striyaḥ visrasta mālā ābharaṇāḥ kuru udvaha  kṛṣṇa vikrīḍitam vīkṣya mumuhuḥ khecara striyaḥ
translated: their garlands and ornaments fallen.🔽Seeing Kṛṣṇa's pastimes, the women of the sky-walkers became bewildered.

original: kāmārditāḥ śaśāṅkaś ca sagaṇo vismito 'bhavat🔽kṛtvā tāvantam ātmānaṃ yāvatīr gopayoṣitaḥ
analyzed: kāma arditāḥ śaśāṅkaḥ ca sa gaṇaḥ vismitaḥ bhavat  kṛtvā tāvantam ātmānam yāvatīḥ gopa yoṣitaḥ
translated: Afflicted by lust, the moon and his followers became amazed.🔽The Supreme Lord, although self-satisfied, enjoyed with them, as many times as there were cowherd women,

original: reme sa bhagavāṃs tābhir ātmārāmo 'pi līlayā

translated: Arriving at Nanda's Vraja, the glorious one, as the sun was setting,🔽entered, covered by the dust raised by the hooves of the cattle as they entered.🔽It was resounding with the bulls, who were fighting for the sake of cows in heat,

original: itas tato vilaṅghadbhir govatsair maṇḍitaṃ sitaiḥ
analyzed: itas tatas vilaṅghadbhiḥ go vatsaiḥ maṇḍitam sitaiḥ

analyzed: godoha śabda abhiravam veṇūnām niḥsvanena ca
translated: It was resounding with the sounds of milking cows, the whistling of flutes,

analyzed: gāyantībhiḥ ca karmāṇi śubhāni bala kṛṣṇayoḥ
translated: and the singing of auspicious deeds of Balarāma and Kṛṣṇa

analyzed: su alaṅkṛtābhiḥ gopībhiḥ gopaiḥ ca su virājitam
translated: by the well-adorned gopīs, and it was beautifully illuminated by the cowherds.

analyzed: agni arka atithi go vipra pitṛ deva arcana anvitaiḥ
translated: It was endowed with worship of fire, sun, guests, cows, brāhmaṇas, forefathers and deities,

original: dhūpadīpaiś ca mālyaiś ca gopāvāsair manoramam
analyzed: dhūpa dīpaiḥ ca mālyaiḥ ca gopa āvāsaiḥ manoramam
translated: with incense, lamps, garlands, and the abodes of the cowherds, it was delightful.

analyzed: sarvatas puṣpita vanam dvija āli kula nāditam
translated: The forest was blooming everywhere, resounding with the cries of flocks of birds.

analyzed: haṃsa kāraṇḍava ākīrṇaiḥ padma ṣaṇḍaiḥ ca maṇḍitam
translated: And adorned with clusters of lotuses filled with swans and Kāraṇḍava ducks.

analyzed: tam āgatam samāgamya kṛṣṇasya anucaram priyam
translated: Approaching him who had come, the dear follower of Kṛṣṇa,

analyzed: nandaḥ prītaḥ pariṣvajya vāsudeva dhiyā arcayat
translated: Nanda, pleased, embraced him and worshipped him, regarding him as Vāsudeva.

analyzed: bhojitam parama annena saṃviṣṭam kaśipau sukham
translated: Having been fed with excellent food and comfortably seated on a couch,

original: gataśramaṃ paryapṛcchat pādasaṃvāhanādibhiḥ🔽kaccid aṅga mahābhāga sakhā naḥ śūranandanaḥ
analyzed: gata śramam paryapṛcchat pāda saṃvāhana ādibhiḥ  kaccit aṅga mahābhāga sakhā naḥ śūra nandanaḥ
translated: he was asked about his fatigue being relieved by having his feet washed and other services.

original: āste kuśaly apatyādyair yukto muktaḥ suhṛdvrataḥ
analyzed: āste kuśalī apatya ādyaiḥ yuktaḥ muktaḥ suhṛd vrataḥ
translated: O illustrious one, is our hero's son well, along with his children and others, free from enmity and devoted to his friends?

original: diṣṭyā kaṃso hataḥ pāpaḥ sānugaḥ svena pāpmanā
analyzed: diṣṭyā kaṃsaḥ hataḥ pāpaḥ sa anugaḥ svena pāpmanā
translated: By good fortune, the sinful Kaṃsa has been killed along with his followers by his own evil deeds,

original: sādhūnāṃ dharmaśīlānāṃ yadūnāṃ dveṣṭi yaḥ sadā
analyzed: sādhūnām dharma śīlānām yadūnām dveṣṭi yaḥ sadā

original: api smarati naḥ kṛṣṇo mātaraṃ suhṛdaḥ sakhīn🔽gopān vrajaṃ cātmanāthaṃ gāvo vṛndāvanaṃ girim
analyzed: api smarati naḥ kṛṣṇaḥ mātaram suhṛdaḥ sakhīn  gopān vrajam ca ātmanātham gāvaḥ vṛndāvanam girim
translated: Does Kṛṣṇa remember his mother, friends and companions?🔽The cowherds, Vraja, his own lord, the cows, the Vṛndāvana forest and the mountain?

original: apy āyāsyati govindaḥ svajanān sakṛd īkṣitum
analyzed: api āyāsyati govindaḥ sva janān sakṛt īkṣitum
translated: Will Govinda come to see his relatives just once?

analyzed: tarhi drakṣyāma tad vaktram su nasam su smita īkṣaṇam

original: dāvāgner vātavarṣāc ca vṛṣasarpāc ca rakṣitāḥ
analyzed: dāva agneḥ vāta varṣāt ca vṛṣa sarpāt ca rakṣitāḥ
translated: Protected from forest fires, storms and rain, bulls and snakes,

analyzed: duratyayebhyaḥ mṛtyubhyaḥ kṛṣṇena su mahātmanā
translated: from difficult-to-surmount deaths, by the very magnanimous Kṛṣṇa.

analyzed: smaratām kṛṣṇa vīryāṇi līlā apāṅga nirīkṣitam
translated: Remembering the prowess of Krishna, the sidelong glances of His pastimes,

analyzed: hasitam bhāṣitam ca aṅga sarvāḥ naḥ śithilāḥ kriyāḥ
translated: His laughter, His words, and His limbs, all our activities have become slack.

analyzed: sarit śaila vana uddeśāt mukunda pada bhūṣitān
translated: The places by the rivers, mountains, and forests, adorned with the footprints of Mukunda,

analyzed: ākrīḍān īkṣyamāṇānām manaḥ yāti tad ātma tām
translated: When we see them, our minds become absorbed in Him.

original: manye kṛṣṇaṃ ca rāmaṃ ca prāptāv iha surottamau
analyzed: manye kṛṣṇam ca rāmam ca prāptau iha sura uttamau
translated: I think Krishna and Rama have come here as the best of gods

analyzed: surāṇām mahat arthāya gargasya vacanam yathā  kaṃsam nāga ayuta prāṇam mallau gaja patim yathā  avadhiṣṭām līlayā eva paśūn iva mṛgādhipaḥ
translated: For the great purpose of the gods, just as Garga said.🔽Like the lord of beasts easily killing animals, He has killed Kamsa, whose life force was like ten thousand elephants, and the wrestlers like the lord of elephants.

analyzed: tāla trayam mahā sāram dhanuḥ yaṣṭim iva ibha rāj
translated: With one hand, He broke the palm tree, which was very strong, like a bamboo,

analyzed: babhañja ekena hastena sapta aham adadhāt girim
translated: And held up the mountain for seven days.
Pralamba, Dhenuka, Aristha, Trinavarta, Baka, and other demons,

analyzed: daityāḥ sura asura jitaḥ hatāḥ yena iha līlayā
translated: Who were unconquerable by gods and demons, were playfully killed by Him here.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Shuka said:

analyzed: iti saṃsmṛtya saṃsmṛtya nandaḥ kṛṣṇa anurakta dhīḥ
translated: Thus remembering and remembering again, Nanda, whose mind was attached to Krishna,

analyzed: ati utkaṇṭhaḥ bhavat tūṣṇīm prema prasara vihvalaḥ
translated: Became extremely anxious, silent, overwhelmed by the flow of love.

analyzed: yaśodā varṇyamānāni putrasya caritāni ca
translated: Yashoda, describing the deeds of her son,

analyzed: śṛṇvantī aśrūṇi avāsrākṣīt sneha snuta payodharā
translated: Shedding tears, her breasts overflowing with affection, she listened to their words.

analyzed: tayoḥ ittham bhagavati kṛṣṇe nanda yaśodayoḥ
translated: Thus, Nanda and Yashoda, the parents of Lord Krishna,

analyzed: vīkṣya anurāgam paramam nandam āha uddhavaḥ mudā
translated: Seeing their great affection for the Lord, Uddhava joyfully said to Nanda:

analyzed: śrī uddhavaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Uddhava said:

original: yuvāṃ ślāghyatamau nūnaṃ dehinām iha mānada
analyzed: yuvām ślāghyatamau nūnam dehinām iha mānada
translated: O Nanda, you two are certainly the most praiseworthy among embodied beings here,

analyzed: nārāyaṇe khila gurau yat kṛtā matiḥ īdṛśī
translated: Since you have set your mind on Nārāyaṇa, the guru of all.

original: etau hi viśvasya ca bījayonī rāmo mukundaḥ puruṣaḥ pradhānam
analyzed: etau hi viśvasya ca bīja yonī rāmaḥ mukundaḥ puruṣaḥ pradhānam
translated: These two, Rāma and Mukunda, are the seed and source of the universe, the Puruṣa and Prakṛti,

original: anvīya bhūteṣu vilakṣaṇasya jñānasya ceśāta imau purāṇau
analyzed: anvīya bhūteṣu vilakṣaṇasya jñānasya ca īśātaḥ imau purāṇau
translated: Following whom, this ancient pair is the source of knowledge, which is distinct from the elements.

original: yasmin janaḥ prāṇaviyogakāle kṣanaṃ samāveśya mano 'viśuddham
analyzed: yasmin janaḥ prāṇa viyoga kāle kṣanam samāveśya manaḥ viśuddham
translated: When a person, at the time of separation from the body, focuses his impure mind on them for a moment,

original: nirhṛtya karmāśayam āśu yāti parāṃ gatiṃ brahmamayo 'rkavarṇaḥ
analyzed: nirhṛtya karma āśayam āśu yāti parām gatim brahma mayaḥ rka varṇaḥ
translated: Quickly removes the impressions of his past actions, and attains the supreme goal, becoming Brahman, with the complexion of the sun.

analyzed: tasmin bhavantau akhila ātma hetau nārāyaṇe kāraṇa martya mūrtau
translated: In that Nārāyaṇa, the cause of all souls, who has taken a mortal form,

original: bhāvaṃ vidhattāṃ nitarāṃ mahātman kiṃ vāvaśiṣṭaṃ yuvayoḥ sukṛtyam
analyzed: bhāvam vidhattām nitarām mahātman kim vā avaśiṣṭam yuvayoḥ su kṛtyam

analyzed: āgamiṣyati adīrgheṇa kālena vrajam acyutaḥ
translated: In a short time, Acyuta will come to Vraja.

original: priyaṃ vidhāsyate pitror bhagavān sātvatāṃ patiḥ
analyzed: priyam vidhāsyate pitroḥ bhagavān sātvatām patiḥ
translated: The Lord, the master of the Sātvatas, will do what is pleasing to His parents.

analyzed: hatvā kaṃsam raṅga madhye pratīpam sarva sātvatām
translated: Having killed Kaṃsa in the middle of the arena, who was hostile to all the Sātvatas,

original: yad āha vaḥ samāgatya kṛṣṇaḥ satyaṃ karoti tat
analyzed: yat āha vaḥ samāgatya kṛṣṇaḥ satyam karoti tat
translated: Kṛṣṇa has come to you and is doing what he said he would do.

original: mā khidyataṃ mahābhāgau drakṣyathaḥ kṛṣṇam antike
analyzed: mā khidyatam mahābhāgau drakṣyathaḥ kṛṣṇam antike
translated: O greatly fortunate ones, do not grieve. You will see Kṛṣṇa nearby.

original: antar hṛdi sa bhūtānām āste jyotir ivaidhasi
analyzed: antar hṛdi sa bhūtānām āste jyotiḥ iva edhasi
translated: He resides in the hearts of beings like a fire in a tree.

analyzed: na hi asya asti priyaḥ kaścid na apriyaḥ vā asti amāninaḥ
translated: He has no one dear to him, nor anyone he dislikes. He is free from pride.

analyzed: na uttamaḥ na adhamaḥ vā api vā
translated: He is neither superior nor inferior, nor is he equal or unequal.

original: na mātā na pitā tasya na bhāryā na sutādayaḥ
analyzed: na mātā na pitā tasya na bhāryā na suta ādayaḥ
translated: He has no mother, no father, no wife, no children, and so on.

original: nātmīyo na paraś cāpi na deho janma eva ca
analyzed: na ātmīyaḥ na paraḥ ca api na dehaḥ janma eva ca
translated: He has no one of his own, nor anyone else. He has no body, nor any birth.

original: na cāsya karma vā loke sadasanmiśrayoniṣu
analyzed: na ca asya karma vā loke sat asat miśra yoniṣu
translated: He has no karma in the world, in the wombs that are a mixture of good and bad.

analyzed: krīḍā artham saḥ pi sādhūnām paritrāṇāya kalpate
translated: Even that, for the sake of play, becomes fit for the protection of the good.

original: sattvaṃ rajas tama iti bhajate nirguṇo guṇān
analyzed: sattvam rajaḥ tamaḥ iti bhajate nirguṇaḥ guṇān

original: krīḍann atīto 'pi guṇaiḥ sṛjaty avan hanty ajaḥ
analyzed: krīḍan atītaḥ u pi guṇaiḥ sṛjati avan hanti ajaḥ

analyzed: yathā bhramarikā dṛṣṭyā bhrāmyati iva mahīyate
translated: Just as the earth appears to be whirling due to the perception of a whirling firebrand,

analyzed: citte kartari tatra ātmā kartā iva ahaṃdhiyā smṛtaḥ

original: yuvayor eva naivāyam ātmajo bhagavān hariḥ
analyzed: yuvayoḥ eva na eva ayam ātmajaḥ bhagavān hariḥ

original: sarveṣām ātmajo hy ātmā pitā mātā sa īśvaraḥ
analyzed: sarveṣām ātma jaḥ hi ātmā pitā mātā saḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: For all, the self is the son of the self, the father, the mother, and the Lord.

analyzed: dṛṣṭam śrutam bhūta bhavat bhaviṣyat
translated: What is seen, heard, past, present and future,

analyzed: sthāsnuḥ cariṣṇuḥ mahat alpakam ca
translated: The moving and unmoving, the great and the small,

analyzed: vinā acyutāt vastu tarām na vācyam
translated: Without Acyuta, nothing can be said to exist.

analyzed: saḥ eva sarvam paramātma bhūtaḥ
translated: He alone is all, the supreme Self.

original: evaṃ niśā sā bruvator vyatītā nandasya kṛṣṇānucarasya rājan
analyzed: evam niśā sā bruvatoḥ vyatītā nandasya kṛṣṇa anucarasya rājan
translated: Thus, O king, the night passed as Nanda, a follower of Krishna, spoke in this way.

original: gopyaḥ samutthāya nirūpya dīpān vāstūn samabhyarcya daudhīny amanthun🔽tā dīpadīptair maṇibhir virejū rajjūr vikarṣadbhujakaṅkaṇasrajaḥ🔽calannitambastanahārakuṇḍala tviṣatkapolāruṇakuṅkumānanāḥ
analyzed: gopyaḥ samutthāya nirūpya dīpān vāstūn samabhyarcya daudhīni amanthun  tāḥ dīpa dīptaiḥ maṇibhiḥ virejuḥ rajjūḥ vikarṣat bhuja kaṅkaṇa srajaḥ
translated: The cowherdesses got up, arranged the lamps, worshipped the household deities, and churned the curd.🔽They shone with jewels illuminated by the lamps, pulling ropes, armlets, and garlands.🔽With their hips, breasts, necklaces, and earrings moving, their cheeks shining, and their faces red with saffron,

original: udgāyatīnām aravindalocanaṃ vrajāṅganānāṃ divam aspṛśad dhvaniḥ
analyzed: udgāyatīnām aravinda locanam vraja aṅganānām divam aspṛśat dhvaniḥ
translated: The sound of the cowherdesses singing to the lotus-eyed Lord reached heaven,

original: dadhnaś ca nirmanthanaśabdamiśrito nirasyate yena diśām amaṅgalam🔽bhagavaty udite sūrye nandadvāri vrajaukasaḥ
analyzed: dadhnaḥ ca nirmanthana śabda miśritaḥ nirasyate yena diśām amaṅgalam  bhagavati udite sūrye nanda dvāri vraja okasaḥ
translated: Mixed with the sound of churning curd, which removes inauspiciousness from the directions.🔽When the Lord rose in the east, the people of Vraja saw a chariot made of gold at Nanda's door

original: dṛṣṭvā rathaṃ śātakaumbhaṃ kasyāyam iti cābruvan
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ratham śātakaumbham kasya ayam iti ca abruvan

original: akrūra āgataḥ kiṃ vā yaḥ kaṃsasyārthasādhakaḥ
analyzed: akrūraḥ āgataḥ kim vā yaḥ kaṃsasya artha sādhakaḥ
translated: Has Akrura come, who fulfills the purpose of Kamsa?

analyzed: yena nītaḥ madhupurīm kṛṣṇaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: By whom the lotus-eyed Krishna was taken to Mathura.

original: kiṃ sādhayiṣyaty asmābhir bhartuḥ prītasya niṣkṛtim
analyzed: kim sādhayiṣyati asmābhiḥ bhartuḥ prītasya niṣkṛtim
translated: What will he accomplish for us, the repayment of our grateful lord?

analyzed: tatas strīṇām vadantīnām uddhavaḥ gāt kṛta āhnikaḥ
translated: Then, as the women were speaking, Uddhava came, having finished his daily duties.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Shuka said:

original: taṃ vīkṣya kṛṣānucaraṃ vrajastriyaḥ🔽pralambabāhuṃ navakañjalocanam🔽pītāmbaraṃ puṣkaramālinaṃ lasan
analyzed: tam vīkṣya kṛṣā anucaram vraja striyaḥ  pralamba bāhum nava kañja locanam  pīta ambaram puṣkara mālinam lasan
translated: Seeing him, the cowherd women,🔽with long arms, eyes like fresh lotuses,

analyzed: mukha aravindam parimṛṣṭa kuṇḍalam
translated: wearing yellow garments, with a garland of lotuses, his lotus face shining, his earrings polished,

analyzed: su vismitāḥ kaḥ yam
translated: were greatly amazed: Who is this of incomparable beauty?

analyzed: kutas ca kasya acyuta veṣa bhūṣaṇaḥ
translated: Where is he from? Whose is he? He has the dress and ornaments of Achyuta.

analyzed: iti sma sarvāḥ parivavruḥ utsukāḥ
translated: Thus all of them surrounded him eagerly,

analyzed: tam uttamaḥśloka pada ambuja āśrayam
translated: he who was the abode of the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: tam praśrayeṇa avanatāḥ su satkṛtam sa vrīḍa hāsa īkṣaṇa sūnṛta ādibhiḥ
translated: They bowed to him with humility, honored him well with bashful smiles, sweet words, etc.,

original: rahasy apṛcchann upaviṣṭam āsane vijñāya sandeśaharaṃ ramāpateḥ
analyzed: rahasi apṛcchan upaviṣṭam āsane vijñāya sandeśa haram ramāpateḥ
translated: and asked him, seated on a couch in private, knowing him to be the messenger of the lord of Lakshmi.

analyzed: jānīmaḥ tvām yadu pateḥ pārṣadam samupāgatam
translated: We know you as the attendant of the lord of the Yadus who has come here.

analyzed: bhartrā iha preṣitaḥ pitroḥ bhavān priya cikīrṣayā
translated: You have been sent by your master to your parents, desiring to do what is pleasing to them.

original: anyathā govraje tasya smaraṇīyaṃ na cakṣmahe
analyzed: anyathā go vraje tasya smaraṇīyam na cakṣmahe
translated: Otherwise, we do not remember anything else about him in the cowherds' village.

analyzed: sneha anubandhaḥ bandhūnām muneḥ api su dustyajaḥ
translated: The bond of affection with relatives is very difficult to give up even for a sage.

analyzed: anyeṣu artha kṛtā maitrī yāvat artha viḍambanam
translated: The friendship of others is for the sake of money, and it is only as long as there is money.

original: pumbhiḥ strīṣu kṛtā yadvat sumanaḥsv iva ṣaṭpadaiḥ
analyzed: pumbhiḥ strīṣu kṛtā yadvat sumanaḥsu iva ṣaṭpadaiḥ
translated: Just as men have made friendship with women, like bees with flowers.

original: niḥsvaṃ tyajanti gaṇikā akalpaṃ nṛpatiṃ prajāḥ
analyzed: niḥsvam tyajanti gaṇikāḥ akalpam nṛpatim prajāḥ
translated: Courtesans abandon a penniless man, subjects abandon a king who cannot provide for them,

analyzed: adhīta vidyāḥ ācāryam ṛtvijaḥ datta dakṣiṇam
translated: students abandon a teacher who has finished teaching, priests abandon a patron who has finished paying the fees,

original: khagā vītaphalaṃ vṛkṣaṃ bhuktvā cātithayo gṛham🔽dagdhaṃ mṛgās tathāraṇyaṃ jārā bhuktvā ratāṃ striyam
analyzed: khagāḥ vīta phalam vṛkṣam bhuktvā ca atithayaḥ gṛham  dagdham mṛgāḥ tathā araṇyam jārāḥ bhuktvā ratām striyam
translated: birds abandon a tree that has lost its fruit, guests abandon a house that has been enjoyed,🔽deer abandon a forest that has been burnt, and paramours abandon a woman who has been enjoyed.

analyzed: iti gopyaḥ hi govinde gata vāc kāya mānasāḥ
translated: Thus, the gopīs, with their speech, body and mind absorbed in Govinda,

analyzed: kṛṣṇa dūte samāyāte uddhave tyakta laukikāḥ
translated: when Uddhava, the messenger of Kṛṣṇa, arrived, they abandoned worldly concerns.

analyzed: gāyantyaḥ prīya karmāṇi rudantyaḥ ca gata hriyaḥ
translated: Singing about his pleasing deeds and crying, they gave up shame.

analyzed: tasya saṃsmṛtya saṃsmṛtya yāni kaiśora bālyayoḥ
translated: Remembering again and again the things he did in his youth and childhood,

analyzed: kācid madhukaram dṛṣṭvā dhyāyantī kṛṣṇa saṅgamam
translated: One gopī, seeing a bee, meditating on her union with Kṛṣṇa,

analyzed: priya prasthāpitam dūtam kalpayitvā idam abravīt
translated: imagining it to be a messenger sent by her beloved, said this:
