translated: But they could not lift it up. Eagerly they informed Kṛṣṇa.

original: tatrāgatyāravindākṣo bhagavān viśvabhāvanaḥ🔽vīkṣyojjahāra vāmena taṃ kareṇa sa līlayā
analyzed: tatra āgatya aravinda akṣaḥ bhagavān viśvabhāvanaḥ  vīkṣya ujjahāra vāmena tam kareṇa sa līlayā
translated: Then the lotus-eyed Lord, the creator of the universe, came there.🔽Seeing it, He playfully lifted it up with His left hand.

analyzed: saḥ uttamaḥśloka kara abhimṛṣṭaḥ vihāya sadyas kṛkalāsa rūpam
translated: Touched by the hand of the Supreme Lord, it immediately gave up its chameleon form
and assumed a beautiful complexion like heated gold, and wonderful ornaments, garments and garlands.

original: papraccha vidvān api tannidānaṃ janeṣu vikhyāpayituṃ mukundaḥ
analyzed: papraccha vidvān api tad nidānam janeṣu vikhyāpayitum mukundaḥ
translated: Although wise, Mukunda asked about the cause of this, in order to proclaim it among the people.

original: kas tvaṃ mahābhāga vareṇyarūpo devottamaṃ tvāṃ gaṇayāmi nūnam
analyzed: kaḥ tvam mahābhāga vareṇya rūpaḥ deva uttamam tvām gaṇayāmi nūnam
translated: Who are you, O illustrious one, of excellent form? I consider you to be the best of gods.

original: daśām imāṃ vā katamena karmaṇā samprāpito 'sy atadarhaḥ subhadra
analyzed: daśām imām vā katamena karmaṇā samprāpitaḥ si a tad arhaḥ su bhadra
translated: Or by what deed have you attained this condition, O good one, though not deserving it?

original: ātmānam ākhyāhi vivitsatāṃ no yan manyase naḥ kṣamam atra vaktum
analyzed: ātmānam ākhyāhi vivitsatām naḥ yat manyase naḥ kṣamam atra vaktum
translated: Tell us who are desirous of knowing, what you think fit to speak to us here.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

analyzed: iti sma rājā sampṛṣṭaḥ kṛṣṇena ananta mūrtinā
translated: Thus questioned by Kṛṣṇa, whose form is infinite,

analyzed: mādhavam praṇipatya āha kirīṭena arka varcasā
translated: the king, bowing to Mādhava with a crown radiant like the sun, said:

analyzed: nṛgaḥ uvāca
translated: Nṛga said:

analyzed: nṛgaḥ nāma narendraḥ ham ikṣvāku tanayaḥ prabho
translated: I am a king named Nṛga, the son of Ikṣvāku, O lord,

original: dāniṣv ākhyāyamāneṣu yadi te karṇam aspṛśam
analyzed: dāniṣu ākhyāyamāneṣu yadi te karṇam aspṛśam
translated: if I have touched your ear while speaking of gifts.

analyzed: kim nu te viditam nātha sarva bhūta ātma sākṣiṇaḥ
translated: What is unknown to you, O lord, who are the witness of the soul of all beings?

analyzed: kālena avyāhata dṛśaḥ vakṣye thā api tava ājñayā
translated: Yet I shall speak by your command, O one whose vision is unimpeded by time.

original: yāvatyaḥ sikatā bhūmer yāvatyo divi tārakāḥ
analyzed: yāvatyaḥ sikatāḥ bhūmeḥ yāvatyaḥ divi tārakāḥ
translated: As many grains of sand there are on earth, as many stars there are in the sky,

original: yāvatyo varṣadhārāś ca tāvatīr adadaṃ sma gāḥ
analyzed: yāvatyaḥ varṣa dhārāḥ ca tāvatīḥ adadam sma gāḥ
translated: and as many drops of rain there are, I have given away that many cows.

original: payasvinīs taruṇīḥ śīlarūpa guṇopapannāḥ kapilā hemasṛṅgīḥ
analyzed: payasvinīḥ taruṇīḥ śīla rūpa guṇa upapannāḥ kapilāḥ hema sṛṅgīḥ
translated: Milking cows, young, of good character and form, endowed with good qualities, tawny, with golden udders,

original: nyāyārjitā rūpyakhurāḥ savatsā dukūlamālābharaṇā dadāv aham
analyzed: nyāya arjitāḥ rūpya khurāḥ sa vatsāḥ dukūla mālā ābharaṇāḥ dadau aham
translated: I have given away cows whose horns were made of silver, along with their calves, adorned with garlands and ornaments of fine silk.

analyzed: su alaṅkṛtebhyaḥ guṇa śīlavadbhyaḥ sīdat kuṭumbebhyaḥ ṛta vratebhyaḥ
translated: To those who are well-adorned, virtuous, and of good character, to those whose families are in decline, to those who are truthful and righteous,

analyzed: tapaḥ śruta brahma vadānya sadbhyaḥ prādām yuvabhyaḥ dvija puṅgavebhyaḥ
translated: To you young bulls among Brahmins, who are devoted to austerities, learning, Brahmanical knowledge, and charity, I have given cows, land, gold, houses, horses, elephants,

analyzed: go bhū hiraṇya āyatana aśva hastinaḥ kanyāḥ sa dāsīḥ tila rūpya śayyāḥ
translated: Girls, female servants, sesame seeds, silver beds,

original: vāsāṃsi ratnāni paricchadān rathān iṣṭaṃ ca yajñaiś caritaṃ ca pūrtam
analyzed: vāsāṃsi ratnāni paricchadān rathān iṣṭam ca yajñaiḥ caritam ca pūrtam
translated: Clothes, jewels, ornaments, chariots, desired sacrifices, and performed vows.

original: kasyacid dvijamukhyasya bhraṣṭā gaur mama godhane
analyzed: kasyacid dvijamukhyasya bhraṣṭā gauḥ mama go dhane
translated: The cow of a certain chief Brahmin was lost in my cattle pen.

original: sampṛktāviduṣā sā ca mayā dattā dvijātaye
analyzed: sampṛktā a viduṣā sā ca mayā dattā dvijātaye
translated: And that cow, which was not known to me, was given by me to a Brahmin.

original: tāṃ nīyamānāṃ tatsvāmī dṛṣṭrovāca mameti tam
analyzed: tām nīyamānām tad svāmī dṛṣṭrā uvāca mama iti tam
translated: Seeing her being taken away, the owner said, This is mine.

original: mameti parigrāhy āha nṛgo me dattavān iti🔽viprau vivadamānau mām ūcatuḥ svārthasādhakau
analyzed: mama iti parigrāhī āha nṛgaḥ me dattavān iti  viprau vivadamānau mām ūcatuḥ sva artha sādhakau
translated: This is mine, he said, King Nriga has given it to me.

original: bhavān dātāpaharteti tac chrutvā me 'bhavad bhramaḥ
analyzed: bhavān dātā apahartā iti tat śrutvā me bhavat bhramaḥ
translated: The two Brahmins, arguing, said to me, You are the giver and the taker. Hearing that, I became confused.

analyzed: anunītau ubhau viprau dharma kṛcchra gatena vai
translated: Both the Brahmins were entreated by me, who was in a difficult situation due to dharma.🔽I will give a lakh of excellent cows. Let her be given to me.

original: gavāṃ lakṣaṃ prakṛṣṭānāṃ dāsyāmy eṣā pradīyatām🔽bhavantāv anugṛhṇītāṃ kiṅkarasyāvijānataḥ
analyzed: gavām lakṣam prakṛṣṭānām dāsyāmi eṣā pradīyatām 🔽bhavantau anugṛhṇītām kiṅkarasya a vijānataḥ
translated: Please favor me, who is ignorant.

analyzed: samuddharatam mām kṛcchrāt patantam niraye śucau
translated: Please rescue me from this distress, as I am falling into the impure hell.

original: nāhaṃ pratīcche vai rājann ity uktvā svāmy apākramat
analyzed: na aham pratīcche vai rājan iti uktvā svāmī apākramat
translated: O king, I do not accept this. Having said this, the master departed.

original: nānyad gavām apy ayutam icchāmīty aparo yayau
analyzed: na anyat gavām api ayutam icchāmi iti aparaḥ yayau
translated: Another one went away, saying, I do not desire anything else, not even ten thousand cows.

original: etasminn antare yāmair dūtair nīto yamakṣayam
analyzed: etasmin antare yāmaiḥ dūtaiḥ nītaḥ yama kṣayam
translated: In the meantime, I was taken by the messengers of Yama to the abode of Yama.

analyzed: yamena pṛṣṭaḥ tatra aham devadeva jagatpate
translated: There, I was asked by Yama, O Lord of gods, Lord of the universe,

original: pūrvaṃ tvam aśubhaṃ bhuṅkṣa utāho nṛpate śubham
analyzed: pūrvam tvam aśubham bhuṅkṣe uta aho nṛpate śubham
translated: are you first experiencing the inauspicious, or the auspicious, O king?

original: nāntaṃ dānasya dharmasya paśye lokasya bhāsvataḥ
analyzed: na antam dānasya dharmasya paśye lokasya bhāsvataḥ
translated: I do not see an end to the light of the world, to charity and righteousness.

original: pūrvaṃ devāśubhaṃ bhuñja iti prāha pateti saḥ
analyzed: pūrvam deva aśubham bhuñje iti prāha pata iti saḥ
translated: He said, First, O god, experience the inauspicious.

original: tāvad adrākṣam ātmānaṃ kṛkalāsaṃ patan prabho
analyzed: tāvat adrākṣam ātmānam kṛkalāsam patan prabho
translated: Then, O Lord, I saw myself falling as a lizard.

analyzed: brahmaṇyasya vadānyasya tava dāsasya keśava
translated: O Keshava, of you, who are devoted to Brahma, generous, and my master,

original: smṛtir nādyāpi vidhvastā bhavatsandarśanārthinaḥ🔽sa tvaṃ kathaṃ mama vibho 'kṣipathaḥ parātmā
analyzed: smṛtiḥ na adya api vidhvastā bhavat sandarśana arthinaḥ  sa tvam katham mama vibho kṣipathaḥ parātmā
translated: the memory of one who desires to see you has not been destroyed even today.

analyzed: sākṣāt adhokṣajaḥ uru vyasana andha buddheḥ
translated: How is it that you, the Supreme Self, the Lord of Yoga, who are to be contemplated in the pure heart of the Vedas,🔽the manifest Adhokshaja, are directly visible to me, whose intellect is blinded by great misfortune,

analyzed: syāt me nu dṛśyaḥ iha yasya bhava apavargaḥ
translated: by whom liberation from worldly existence is obtained here?

analyzed: devadeva jagannātha govinda puruṣottama
translated: God of gods, lord of the universe, Govinda, supreme being,

analyzed: nārāyaṇa hṛṣīkeśa puṇyaśloka acyuta avyaya
translated: Narayana, Hrishikesha, of holy fame, Achyuta, imperishable one,

original: anujānīhi māṃ kṛṣṇa yāntaṃ devagatiṃ prabho
analyzed: anujānīhi mām kṛṣṇa yāntam deva gatim prabho
translated: Give me permission, O Krishna, to go to the abode of the gods, O lord,

original: yatra kvāpi sataś ceto bhūyān me tvatpadāspadam
analyzed: yatra kvāpi sataḥ cetaḥ bhūyāt me tvad pada āspadam
translated: Wherever my mind may be, may it be the abode of your feet.

analyzed: namaḥ te sarva bhāvāya brahmaṇe nanta śaktaye
translated: Salutations to you, the source of all existence, to Brahman, to the one of infinite power,

analyzed: kṛṣṇāya vāsudevāya yogānām pataye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Krishna, to Vasudeva, to the lord of yogis.

original: ity uktvā taṃ parikramya pādau spṛṣṭvā svamaulinā
analyzed: iti uktvā tam parikramya pādau spṛṣṭvā sva maulinā
translated: Having said this, he circumambulated him, touched his feet with his head,

analyzed: anujñātaḥ vimāna agryam āruhat paśyatām nṛṇām
translated: And with permission, ascended the foremost of aerial cars, while people looked on.

analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ parijanam prāha bhagavān devakī sutaḥ
translated: Krishna, the lord, the son of Devaki, spoke to his attendants,

analyzed: brahmaṇyadevaḥ dharma ātmā rājanyān anuśikṣayan
translated: Brahmanya-deva, the righteous one, instructing the Kshatriyas,

original: durjaraṃ bata brahmasvaṃ bhuktam agner manāg api
analyzed: durjaram bata brahma svam bhuktam agneḥ manāk api
translated: Oh! The wealth of a Brahmana, even a little enjoyed by fire, is difficult to digest,

original: tejīyaso 'pi kim uta rājñāṃ īśvaramāninām🔽nāhaṃ hālāhalaṃ manye viṣaṃ yasya pratikriyā
analyzed: tejīyasaḥ pi kim uta rājñām īśvara māninām  na aham hālāhalam manye viṣam yasya pratikriyā
translated: What to speak of powerful kings who are intoxicated with power?🔽I do not consider poison to be as bad as the wealth of a Brahmana, for it has a remedy,

original: brahmasvaṃ hi viṣaṃ proktaṃ nāsya pratividhir bhuvi
analyzed: brahma svam hi viṣam proktam na asya pratividhiḥ bhuvi
translated: The wealth of a Brahmana is said to be poison, for there is no remedy for it on earth.

original: hinasti viṣam attāraṃ vahnir adbhiḥ praśāmyati
analyzed: hinasti viṣam attāram vahniḥ adbhiḥ praśāmyati
translated: Poison destroys the one who eats it, but fire is pacified by water,

analyzed: kulam sa mūlam dahati brahma sva araṇi pāvakaḥ
translated: The fire of Brahman's property burns the family to its roots.

analyzed: brahma svam duranujñātam bhuktam hanti tri pūruṣam
translated: Brahman's property, when enjoyed after improper acceptance, destroys three generations.

original: prasahya tu balād bhuktaṃ daśa pūrvān daśāparān
analyzed: prasahya tu balāt bhuktam daśa pūrvān daśa aparān
translated: But when forcibly enjoyed by power, it destroys ten generations before and ten generations after.

analyzed: rājānaḥ rāja lakṣmyā andhāḥ na ātmapātam vicakṣate
translated: Kings, blinded by royal glory, do not foresee their own downfall.

original: nirayaṃ ye 'bhimanyante brahmasvaṃ sādhu bāliśāḥ🔽gṛhṇanti yāvataḥ pāṃśūn krandatām aśrubindavaḥ
analyzed: nirayam ye bhimanyante brahma svam sādhu bāliśāḥ  gṛhṇanti yāvataḥ pāṃśūn krandatām aśru bindavaḥ
translated: Foolish people who covet Brahman's property are headed for hell.🔽As many grains of sand are taken up by the falling tears of weeping Brahmins

analyzed: viprāṇām hṛta vṛttīnām vadānyānām kuṭumbinām
translated: whose livelihood has been taken away, of generous householders,

analyzed: rājānaḥ rājakulyāḥ ca tāvataḥ bdāt niraṅkuśāḥ
translated: for so many years, unrestrained, do kings and princes

analyzed: kumbhīpākeṣu pacyante brahma dāya apahāriṇaḥ
translated: who seize Brahman's property get cooked in the hell of Kumbhipaka.

original: svadattāṃ paradattāṃ vā brahmavṛttiṃ harec ca yaḥ
analyzed: sva dattām para dattām vā brahmavṛttim haret ca yaḥ
translated: One who steals the Brahman's livelihood, whether given by himself or by others,

original: ṣaṣṭivarṣasahasrāṇi viṣṭhāyāṃ jāyate kṛmiḥ🔽na me brahmadhanaṃ bhūyād yad gṛdhvālpāyuṣo narāḥ
analyzed: ṣaṣṭi varṣa sahasrāṇi viṣṭhāyām jāyate kṛmiḥ  na me brahma dhanam bhūyāt yat gṛdhvā alpa āyuṣaḥ narāḥ
translated: is born as a worm in feces for sixty thousand years.

analyzed: parājitāḥ cyutāḥ rājyāt bhavanti udvejinaḥ hayaḥ
translated: Let not my Brahmanical wealth be taken away by those short-lived men who, defeated and fallen from their kingdom, become troublesome snakes.

original: vipraṃ kṛtāgasam api naiva druhyata māmakāḥ
analyzed: vipram kṛta āgasam api nā eva druhyata māmakāḥ
translated: My followers, do not offend even a sinful Brahmin,

original: ghnantaṃ bahu śapantaṃ vā namaskuruta nityaśaḥ
analyzed: ghnantam bahu śapantam vā namaskuruta nityaśas
translated: whether he kills or curses much, always bow down to him.

analyzed: yathā aham praṇame viprān anukālam samāhitaḥ
translated: As I bow down to the Brahmanas in due order with a concentrated mind,

original: tathā namata yūyaṃ ca yo 'nyathā me sa daṇḍabhāk
analyzed: tathā namata yūyam ca yaḥ nyathā me sa daṇḍa bhāj
translated: so should you all bow down. He who acts otherwise will be punished by me.

original: brāhmaṇārtho hy apahṛto hartāraṃ pātayaty adhaḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇa arthaḥ hi apahṛtaḥ hartāram pātayati adhas
translated: For, the wealth stolen from a Brahmana drags down the thief to hell.

original: ajānantam api hy enaṃ nṛgaṃ brāhmaṇagaur iva🔽evaṃ viśrāvya bhagavān mukundo dvārakaukasaḥ
analyzed: a jānantam api hi enam nṛgam brāhmaṇa gauḥ iva  evam viśrāvya bhagavān mukundaḥ dvārakā okasaḥ
translated: Even though he does not know, he is like king Nriga, who was turned into a goat by a Brahmana.🔽Having thus proclaimed, the revered Mukunda, the purifier of all worlds,

analyzed: pāvanaḥ sarva lokānām viveśa nija mandiram
translated: entered His own abode in Dvaraka.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Shuka said:

analyzed: balabhadraḥ kuru śreṣṭha bhagavān ratham āsthitaḥ
translated: O best of the Kurus, Lord Balabhadra, seated on a chariot,

analyzed: suhṛd didṛkṣuḥ utkaṇṭhaḥ prayayau nanda gokulam
translated: eager to see His friends, went to Nanda's cowherds' colony.

original: pariṣvaktaś cirotkaṇṭhair gopair gopībhir eva ca
analyzed: pariṣvaktaḥ cira utkaṇṭhaiḥ gopaiḥ gopībhiḥ eva ca
translated: He was embraced by the cowherds and cowherdesses who had been longing for Him for a long time.

analyzed: rāmaḥ bhivādya pitarā āśīrbhiḥ abhinanditaḥ
translated: Rama, having greeted His parents and being greeted with blessings,

original: ciraṃ naḥ pāhi dāśārha sānujo jagadīśvaraḥ
analyzed: ciram naḥ pāhi dāśārha sa anujaḥ jagat īśvaraḥ
translated: said, O Yadava, O Lord of the universe, along with Your younger brothers, protect us for a long time.

original: ity āropyāṅkam āliṅgya netraiḥ siṣicatur jalaiḥ
analyzed: iti āropya aṅkam āliṅgya netraiḥ siṣicatuḥ jalaiḥ
translated: Having thus placed Him on His lap and embraced Him, they sprinkled Him with tears from their eyes.

analyzed: gopa vṛddhān ca vidhivat yaviṣṭhaiḥ abhivanditaḥ
translated: He was duly worshipped by the elders of the cowherds and was greeted by the youngest ones.

analyzed: yathāvayas yathāsakhyam yathāsambandham ātmanaḥ
translated: According to age, friendship, and relationship,

original: samupetyātha gopālān hāsyahastagrahādibhiḥ🔽viśrāntam sukham āsīnaṃ papracchuḥ paryupāgatāḥ
analyzed: samupetya atha gopālān hāsya hasta graha ādibhiḥ  viśrāntam sukham āsīnam papracchuḥ paryupāgatāḥ
translated: Approaching the cowherds with laughter, hand-holding, and so on,🔽they asked, having come and sat down comfortably after resting,

analyzed: pṛṣṭāḥ ca anāmayam sveṣu prema gadgadayā girā
translated: and when asked, they replied with a voice stammering with love,

analyzed: kṛṣṇe kamala pattra akṣe sannyasta akhila rādhasaḥ
translated: O Krishna, lotus-eyed one, with all our hearts we have surrendered to you.

original: kaccin no bāndhavā rāma sarve kuśalam āsate
analyzed: kaccit naḥ bāndhavāḥ rāma sarve kuśalam āsate
translated: O Rama, are all our relatives well?

original: kaccit smaratha no rāma yūyaṃ dārasutānvitāḥ
analyzed: kaccit smaratha naḥ rāma yūyam dāra suta anvitāḥ
translated: O Rama, do you remember us, along with our wives and children?

original: diṣṭyā kaṃso hataḥ pāpo diṣṭyā muktāḥ suhṛjjanāḥ
analyzed: diṣṭyā kaṃsaḥ hataḥ pāpaḥ diṣṭyā muktāḥ suhṛd janāḥ
translated: Fortunate it is that the sinful Kamsa has been killed, fortunate it is that our friends have been freed.

original: nihatya nirjitya ripūn diṣṭyā durgaṃ samāśrītāḥ
analyzed: nihatya nirjitya ripūn diṣṭyā durgam samāśrītāḥ
translated: Fortunate it is that having killed and defeated the enemies, you have come to this fortress.

analyzed: gopyaḥ hasantyaḥ papracchuḥ rāma sandarśana ādṛtāḥ
translated: The cowherdesses, laughing, asked, intent on seeing Rama:

analyzed: kaccit āste sukham kṛṣṇaḥ pura strī jana vallabhaḥ
translated: Does Krishna, the beloved of the women of the city, stay happily?

original: kaccit smarati vā bandhūn pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca saḥ
analyzed: kaccit smarati vā bandhūn pitaram mātaram ca saḥ
translated: Does he remember his relatives, his father and mother?

original: apy asau mātaraṃ draṣṭuṃ sakṛd apy āgamiṣyati
analyzed: api asau mātaram draṣṭum sakṛt api āgamiṣyati
translated: Will he ever come once again to see his mother?

analyzed: api vā smarate smākam anusevām mahā bhujaḥ
translated: Does the mighty-armed one remember our service?

original: mātaraṃ pitaraṃ bhrātṝn patīn putrān svasṝn api
analyzed: mātaram pitaram bhrātṝn patīn putrān svasṝn api
translated: Our mothers, fathers, brothers, husbands, sons, and sisters,

original: yadarthe jahima dāśārha dustyajān svajanān prabho
analyzed: yad arthe jahima dāśārha dustyajān sva janān prabho
translated: for whose sake, O Dasharha, we have given up our dear relatives, O Lord.

original: tā naḥ sadyaḥ parityajya gataḥ sañchinnasauhṛdaḥ
analyzed: tāḥ naḥ sadyas parityajya gataḥ sañchinna sauhṛdaḥ
translated: Having suddenly abandoned us, he has gone, his affection severed.

original: kathaṃ nu tādṛśaṃ strībhir na śraddhīyeta bhāṣitam🔽kathaṃ nu gṛhṇanty anavasthitātmano
analyzed: katham nu tādṛśam strībhiḥ na śraddhīyeta bhāṣitam  katham nu gṛhṇanti anavasthita ātmanaḥ
translated: How could such words spoken by women not be believed?🔽How could the wise women of the city accept the words

analyzed: tāḥ ca saubha pateḥ māyāḥ divya astraiḥ rukmiṇī sutaḥ
translated: The son of Rukmini instantly destroyed the divine illusions of the lord of Saubha,

original: kṣaṇena nāśayām āsa naiśaṃ tama ivoṣṇaguḥ🔽vivyādha pañcaviṃśatyā svarṇapuṅkhair ayomukhaiḥ
analyzed: kṣaṇena nāśayām āsa naiśam tamaḥ iva uṣṇaguḥ  vivyādha pañcaviṃśatyā svarṇa puṅkhaiḥ ayomukhaiḥ
translated: like the sun destroys the night darkness with its rays.🔽He pierced Shalva's standard-bearer with twenty-five arrows with golden nocks and iron heads.

analyzed: śālvasya dhvajinī pālam śaraiḥ sannata parvabhiḥ
translated: With straight-tufted arrows, he struck Shalva's army.

analyzed: śatena atāḍayat śālvam ekaikena asya sainikān
translated: He struck Shalva with a hundred arrows, each one striking his soldiers.

original: daśabhir daśabhir netṝn vāhanāni tribhis tribhiḥ
analyzed: daśabhiḥ daśabhiḥ netṝn vāhanāni tribhiḥ tribhiḥ
translated: With ten arrows each, he struck the leaders, and with three arrows each, he struck the mounts.

original: tad adbhutaṃ mahat karma pradyumnasya mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: tat adbhutam mahat karma pradyumnasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Seeing that great and wonderful deed of the great-souled Pradyumna,

original: dṛṣṭvā taṃ pūjayām āsuḥ sarve svaparasainikāḥ
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tam pūjayām āsuḥ sarve sva para sainikāḥ
translated: all the soldiers on their own side and the enemy's side honored him.

original: bahurūpaikarūpaṃ tad dṛśyate na ca dṛśyate
analyzed: bahu rūpa eka rūpam tat dṛśyate na ca dṛśyate
translated: It was seen to have many forms and one form, yet it was not seen.

analyzed: māyā mayam maya kṛtam durvibhāvyam paraiḥ abhūt
translated: It was made of illusion by Maya, and was difficult for others to comprehend.

original: kvacid bhūmau kvacid vyomni girimūrdhni jale kvacit
analyzed: kvacid bhūmau kvacid vyomni giri mūrdhni jale kvacid
translated: Sometimes on the ground, sometimes in the sky, sometimes on a mountain peak, sometimes in the water,

analyzed: alāta cakra vat bhrāmyat saubham tat duravasthitam
translated: the Saubha chariot whirled like a firebrand, its position difficult to determine.

analyzed: yatra yatra upalakṣyeta sa saubhaḥ saha sainikaḥ
translated: Wherever Saubha was seen, along with its army,

analyzed: śālvaḥ tatas tatas muñcam śarān sātvata yūthapāḥ
translated: the Satvata leaders released arrows from there.

analyzed: śaraiḥ agni arka saṃsparśaiḥ āśīviṣa durāsadaiḥ
translated: Tormented by arrows that were like fire and the sun to the touch, difficult to approach like poisonous snakes,

analyzed: pīḍyamāna pura anīkaḥ śālvaḥ muhyat para īritaiḥ
translated: Shalva, with his army and city afflicted by the enemy, became confused.

analyzed: śālva anīkapa śastra oghaiḥ vṛṣṇi vīrāḥ bhṛśa arditāḥ
translated: The Vrishni heroes, severely afflicted by the multitude of weapons in Shalya's army,

original: na tatyajū raṇaṃ svaṃ svaṃ lokadvayajigīṣavaḥ🔽śālvāmātyo dyumān nāma pradyumnaṃ prak prapīḍitaḥ🔽āsādya gadayā maurvyā vyāhatya vyanadad balī
analyzed: na tatyajuḥ raṇam svam svam loka dvaya jigīṣavaḥ  śālva amātyaḥ dyumān nāma pradyumnam prak prapīḍitaḥ  āsādya gadayā maurvyā vyāhatya vyanadat balī
translated: did not abandon their own battle, desiring victory in both worlds.🔽Dyumna, Shalya's minister, having previously afflicted Pradyumna,🔽approached him and struck him with a club made of black iron, and the powerful one roared.

analyzed: pradyumnam gadayā sīrṇa vakṣaḥ sthalam ariṃdamam
translated: Pradyumna, the enemy-tamer, his chest torn by the club,

analyzed: apovāha raṇāt sūtaḥ dharma vid dāruka ātmajaḥ
translated: was carried away from the battle by his charioteer, Daruka's son, who knew dharma.

analyzed: labdha samjñaḥ muhūrtena kārṣṇiḥ sārathim abravīt
translated: Having regained consciousness in a moment, Krishna's son said to his charioteer:

original: aho asādhv idaṃ sūta yad raṇān me 'pasarpaṇam
analyzed: aho asādhu idam sūta yat raṇāt me pasarpaṇam
translated: Alas, O charioteer, this is not right that I should be carried away from the battle.

original: na yadūnāṃ kule jātaḥ śrūyate raṇavicyutaḥ
analyzed: na yadūnām kule jātaḥ śrūyate raṇa vicyutaḥ
translated: It is not heard that one born in the Yadu clan has fallen from battle.

analyzed: vinā mat klība cittena sūtena prāpta kilbiṣāt
translated: Except through a eunuch-minded charioteer who has incurred sin.

analyzed: kim nu vakṣye bhisaṅgamya pitarau rāma keśavau
translated: What shall I say when I approach my parents, Rama and Keshava?

original: yuddhāt samyag apakrāntaḥ pṛṣṭas tatrātmanaḥ kṣamam🔽vyaktaṃ me kathayiṣyanti hasantyo bhrātṛjāmayaḥ
analyzed: yuddhāt samyak apakrāntaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ tatra ātmanaḥ kṣamam  vyaktam me kathayiṣyanti hasantyaḥ bhrātṛ jāmayaḥ
translated: Having properly retreated from the battle, he asked about his own condition there.

original: klaibyaṃ kathaṃ kathaṃ vīra tavānyaiḥ kathyatāṃ mṛdhe
analyzed: klaibyam katham katham vīra tava anyaiḥ kathyatām mṛdhe
translated: My sisters-in-law will certainly tell me, laughing, How did you, a hero, show cowardice in the battle?

analyzed: sārathiḥ uvāca
translated: The charioteer said:

original: dharmaṃ vijānatāyuṣman kṛtam etan mayā vibho
analyzed: dharmam vijānatā āyuṣman kṛtam etat mayā vibho
translated: O long-lived one, this was done by me, O lord, knowing dharma.

original: sūtaḥ kṛcchragataṃ rakṣed rathinaṃ sārathiṃ rathī
analyzed: sūtaḥ kṛcchra gatam rakṣet rathinam sārathim rathī
translated: The charioteer should protect the warrior in distress, and the warrior should protect the charioteer.

original: etad viditvā tu bhavān mayāpovāhito raṇāt
analyzed: etat viditvā tu bhavān mayā apovāhitaḥ raṇāt
translated: Knowing this, you were taken away from the battle by me.

analyzed: upasṛṣṭaḥ pareṇa iti mūrcchitaḥ gadayā hataḥ
translated: You were struck unconscious by the mace, as if possessed by an enemy.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

analyzed: saḥ upaspṛśya salilam daṃśitaḥ dhṛta kārmukaḥ
translated: Having touched water, he, armored and holding a bow,

original: naya māṃ dyumataḥ pārśvaṃ vīrasyety āha sārathim
analyzed: naya mām dyumataḥ pārśvam vīrasya iti āha sārathim
translated: told his charioteer, Take me to the side of the hero Dyumān.

analyzed: vidhamantam sva sainyāni dyumantam rukmiṇī sutaḥ
translated: The son of Rukmiṇī, smiling, struck Dyumān, who was destroying his own troops,

analyzed: pratihatya pratyavidhyāt nārācaiḥ aṣṭabhiḥ smayan
translated: and pierced him back with eight iron arrows.

original: caturbhiś caturo vāhān sūtam ekena cāhanat
analyzed: caturbhiḥ caturaḥ vāhān sūtam ekena ca ahanat
translated: With four (arrows), he killed his four horses, with one he struck down his charioteer,

original: dvābhyaṃ dhanuś ca ketuṃ ca śareṇānyena vai śiraḥ
analyzed: dvābhyam dhanuḥ ca ketum ca śareṇa anyena vai śiraḥ
translated: with two (arrows), his bow and flag, and with another arrow, his head.

analyzed: gada sātyaki sāmba ādyāḥ jaghnuḥ saubha pateḥ balam
translated: Gada, Sātyaki, Sāmba and others killed the army of the lord of Saubha.

analyzed: petuḥ samudre saubheyāḥ sarve sañchinna kandharāḥ
translated: All the Soubha people fell into the ocean, their necks severed.

analyzed: evam yadūnām śālvānām nighnatām itaretaram
translated: Thus, the Yadus and the Shalvas, killing each other,

original: yuddhaṃ trinavarātraṃ tad abhūt tumulam ulbaṇam
analyzed: yuddham tri nava rātram tat abhūt tumulam ulbaṇam
translated: had a tumultuous and fierce battle for twenty-seven nights.

analyzed: indraprastham gataḥ kṛṣṇaḥ āhūtaḥ dharmasūnunā
translated: Krishna went to Indraprastha, summoned by Dharma's son.

analyzed: rājasūye tha nivṛtte śiśupāle ca saṃsthite
translated: After the Rajasuya sacrifice was over and Shishupala was killed,

original: kuruvṛddhān anujñāpya munīṃś ca sasutāṃ pṛthām
analyzed: kuru vṛddhān anujñāpya munīn ca sa sutām pṛthām
translated: taking leave of the elders of the Kurus, the sages, and Pritha with her sons,

analyzed: nimittāni ati ghorāṇi paśyan dvāravatīm yayau
translated: seeing extremely terrible omens, he went to Dvaravati.

original: āha cāham ihāyāta āryamiśrābhisaṅgataḥ🔽rājanyāś caidyapakṣīyā nūnaṃ hanyuḥ purīṃ mama
analyzed: āha ca aham iha āyātaḥ āryamiśra abhisaṅgataḥ  rājanyāḥ caidya pakṣīyāḥ nūnam hanyuḥ purīm mama
translated: And he said, I have come here, having met with the noble ones and their followers.🔽The Kshatriyas who sided with the son of Vrishaka will surely destroy my city.

original: vīkṣya tat kadanaṃ svānāṃ nirūpya purarakṣaṇam
analyzed: vīkṣya tat kadanam svānām nirūpya pura rakṣaṇam
translated: Seeing that carnage of his own people and arranging for the protection of the city,

original: saubhaṃ ca śālvarājaṃ ca dārukaṃ prāha keśavaḥ
analyzed: saubham ca śālva rājam ca dārukam prāha keśavaḥ
translated: Keshava said to Daruka about Saubha and King Shalva:

original: rathaṃ prāpaya me sūta śālvasyāntikam āśu vai
analyzed: ratham prāpaya me sūta śālvasya antikam āśu vai
translated: O charioteer, quickly take my chariot to Shalva.

original: sambhramas te na kartavyo māyāvī saubharāḍ ayam
analyzed: sambhramaḥ te na kartavyaḥ māyāvī saubha rāj ayam
translated: You should not be frightened. This king of Saubha is an illusionist.

original: ity uktaś codayām āsa ratham āsthāya dārukaḥ
analyzed: iti uktaḥ codayām āsa ratham āsthāya dārukaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Daruka mounted the chariot and urged it on.

original: viśantaṃ dadṛśuḥ sarve sve pare cāruṇānujam
analyzed: viśantam dadṛśuḥ sarve sve pare ca aruṇānujam
translated: All of them, both their own and the enemy, saw the younger brother of Aruna entering.

analyzed: śālvaḥ ca kṛṣṇam ālokya hata prāya bala īśvaraḥ
translated: Seeing Krishna, Shalva, whose army was mostly killed,

analyzed: prāharat kṛṣṇasūtaya śaktim bhīma ravām mṛdhe
translated: hurled a spear with a terrible sound at Krishna's charioteer in the battle.

original: tām āpatantīṃ nabhasi maholkām iva raṃhasā
analyzed: tām āpatantīm nabhasi mahā ulkām iva raṃhasā
translated: As that spear was falling from the sky with great speed,

analyzed: bhāsayantīm diśaḥ śauriḥ sāyakaiḥ śatadhā ācchinat
translated: illuminating the directions like a large meteor, Shouri cut it into a hundred pieces with his arrows.

original: taṃ ca ṣoḍaśabhir viddhvā bānaiḥ saubhaṃ ca khe bhramat
analyzed: tam ca ṣoḍaśabhiḥ viddhvā bānaiḥ saubham ca khe bhramat
translated: Having pierced him with sixteen arrows and Subha in the sky with a mass of arrows,

original: avidhyac charasandohaiḥ khaṃ sūrya iva raśmibhiḥ🔽śālvaḥ śaures tu doḥ savyaṃ saśārṅgaṃ śārṅgadhanvanaḥ
analyzed: avidhyat śara sandohaiḥ kham sūryaḥ iva raśmibhiḥ  śālvaḥ śaureḥ tu dos savyam sa śārṅgam śārṅgadhanvanaḥ
translated: he pierced the sky with arrows like the sun with its rays.🔽Shalva pierced the left arm of Shouri, the wielder of the Sharnga bow, along with the Sharnga bow.

original: bibheda nyapatad dhastāc chārṅgam āsīt tad adbhutam
analyzed: bibheda nyapatat hastāt śārṅgam āsīt tat adbhutam
translated: The Sharnga bow fell from his hand. It was a wonder.

original: hāhākāro mahān āsīd bhūtānāṃ tatra paśyatām
analyzed: hāhākāraḥ mahān āsīt bhūtānām tatra paśyatām
translated: There was a great cry of Alas! from the beings who saw it there.

original: ninadya saubharāḍ uccair idam āha janārdanam🔽yat tvayā mūḍha naḥ sakhyur bhrātur bhāryā hṛtekṣatām
analyzed: ninadya saubha rāj uccais idam āha janārdanam  yat tvayā mūḍha naḥ sakhyuḥ bhrātuḥ bhāryā hṛtā īkṣatām
translated: The lord of Subha laughed loudly and said this to Janardana:🔽O fool, you have taken away the wife of our friend and brother, who were looking on.

original: pramattaḥ sa sabhāmadhye tvayā vyāpāditaḥ sakhā
analyzed: pramattaḥ sa sabhā madhye tvayā vyāpāditaḥ sakhā
translated: While he was careless in the middle of the assembly, you killed our friend.

analyzed: tam tvā adya niśitaiḥ bāṇaiḥ aparājita māninam
translated: Today, with sharp arrows, I will send you, who think yourself invincible,

analyzed: nayāmi apunarāvṛttim yadi tiṣṭheḥ mama agratas
translated: to the place from which there is no return, if you stand before me.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: vṛthā tvaṃ katthase manda na paśyasy antike 'ntakam
analyzed: vṛthā tvam katthase manda na paśyasi antike ntakam
translated: O fool, you are boasting in vain. You do not see Death standing before you.

original: paurusaṃ darśayanti sma śūrā na bahubhāṣiṇaḥ🔽ity uktvā bhagavāñ chālvaṃ gadayā bhīmavegayā
analyzed: paurusam darśayanti sma śūrāḥ na bahu bhāṣiṇaḥ  iti uktvā bhagavān śālvam gadayā bhīma vegayā
translated: Heroes display their manliness, not by much talk,🔽Having said this, the Lord, with a club of terrible speed,

original: tatāḍa jatrau saṃrabdhaḥ sa cakampe vamann asṛk
analyzed: tatāḍa jatrau saṃrabdhaḥ sa cakampe vaman asṛj
translated: struck Shalva on the collar bone. He trembled and vomited blood.

original: gadāyāṃ sannivṛttāyāṃ śālvas tv antaradhīyata🔽tato muhūrta āgatya puruṣaḥ śirasācyutam
analyzed: gadāyām sannivṛttāyām śālvaḥ tu antaradhīyata  tatas muhūrte āgatya puruṣaḥ śirasā acyutam
translated: When the club was withdrawn, Shalva disappeared.🔽Then, after a moment, a man came and with his head bowed to Achyuta

original: devakyā prahito 'smīti natvā prāha vaco rudan
analyzed: devakyā prahitaḥ smi iti natvā prāha vacaḥ rudan
translated: and, having saluted, spoke these words, weeping:

original: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa mahābāho pitā te pitṛvatsala
analyzed: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa mahā bāho pitā te pitṛ vatsala
translated: Krishna, Krishna, O mighty-armed one, O you who are devoted to your father,

analyzed: baddhvā apanītaḥ śālvena saunikena yathā paśuḥ
translated: my father has been bound and taken away by Shalva, like an animal by a butcher.

original: niśamya vipriyaṃ kṛṣṇo mānusīṃ prakṛtiṃ gataḥ
analyzed: niśamya vipriyam kṛṣṇaḥ mānusīm prakṛtim gataḥ
translated: Hearing this unpleasant news, Krishna reverted to his human nature.

original: vimanasko ghṛṇī snehād babhāṣe prākṛto yathā🔽kathaṃ rāmam asambhrāntaṃ jitvājeyaṃ surāsuraiḥ
analyzed: vimanaskaḥ ghṛṇī snehāt babhāṣe prākṛtaḥ yathā  katham rāmam asambhrāntam jitvā ajeyam sura asuraiḥ
translated: Distressed and compassionate, he spoke like an ordinary person out of affection:🔽How is it that my father, who is invincible to gods and demons, has been taken away by the insignificant Shalva?

original: śālvenālpīyasā nītaḥ pitā me balavān vidhiḥ🔽iti bruvāṇe govinde saubharāṭ pratyupasthitaḥ
analyzed: śālvena alpīyasā nītaḥ pitā me balavān vidhiḥ  iti bruvāṇe govinde saubha rāj pratyupasthitaḥ
translated: Fate is powerful.🔽While Govinda was saying this, the king of Soubha appeared

original: vasudevam ivānīya kṛṣṇaṃ cedam uvāca saḥ
analyzed: vasudevam iva ānīya kṛṣṇam ca idam uvāca saḥ
translated: and, having brought Vasudeva and Krishna, said this to them:

original: eṣa te janitā tāto yadartham iha jīvasi
analyzed: eṣa te janitā tātaḥ yad artham iha jīvasi
translated: He who has created you, your father, for whose sake you are living here,

original: vadhiṣye vīkṣatas te 'mum īśaś cet pāhi bāliśa
analyzed: vadhiṣye vīkṣataḥ te mum īśaḥ ced pāhi bāliśa
translated: If you are the lord, then protect this fool whom I will kill while you look on.

analyzed: evam nirbhartsya māyāvī khaḍgena ānakadundubheḥ
translated: Having thus rebuked him, the magician, with the sword of Anākadundubhi,

original: utkṛtya śira ādāya khasthaṃ saubhaṃ samāviśat
analyzed: utkṛtya śiraḥ ādāya kha stham saubham samāviśat
translated: Cut off his head, took it, and entered Saubha, which was in the sky.

original: tato muhūrtaṃ prakṛtāv upaplutaḥ svabodha āste svajanānuṣaṅgataḥ
analyzed: tatas muhūrtam prakṛtau upaplutaḥ sva bodhe āste sva jana anuṣaṅgataḥ
translated: Then, for a moment, he remained in his natural state, deluded by his own relatives,

original: mahānubhāvas tad abudhyad āsurīṃ māyāṃ sa śālvaprasṛtāṃ mayoditām
analyzed: mahā anubhāvaḥ tat abudhyat āsurīm māyām sa śālva prasṛtām mayā uditām
translated: The greatly powerful one understood that it was the demoness's magic, sent forth by Śālva and created by Maya.

original: na tatra dūtaṃ na pituḥ kalevaraṃ prabuddha ājau samapaśyad acyutaḥ
analyzed: na tatra dūtam na pituḥ kalevaram prabuddhaḥ ājau samapaśyat acyutaḥ
translated: Acyuta, having awakened in the battle, did not see the messenger or his father's body there,

original: svāpnaṃ yathā cāmbaracāriṇaṃ ripuṃ saubhastham ālokya nihantum udyataḥ
analyzed: svāpnam yathā ca ambara cāriṇam ripum saubha stham ālokya nihantum udyataḥ
translated: Just as he had seen the enemy moving in the sky, in Saubha, he was ready to kill him.

original: evaṃ vadanti rājarṣe ṛṣayaḥ ke ca nānvitāḥ
analyzed: evam vadanti rājarṣe ṛṣayaḥ ke ca na anvitāḥ
translated: O royal sage, do not all the sages speak thus?

original: yat svavāco virudhyeta nūnaṃ te na smaranty uta
analyzed: yat sva vācaḥ virudhyeta nūnam te na smaranti uta
translated: If they contradict their own words, surely they do not remember.

original: kva śokamohau sneho vā bhayaṃ vā ye 'jñasambhavāḥ
analyzed: kva śoka mohau snehaḥ vā bhayam vā ye jña sambhavāḥ
translated: Where are grief, delusion, affection, or fear, which arise from ignorance,

analyzed: kva ca akhaṇḍita vijñāna jñāna aiśvaryaḥ tu akhaṇḍitaḥ
translated: And where is the one whose knowledge and power are unbroken, who is unbroken?

analyzed: yad pāda sevā ūrjitayā ātma vidyayā hinvanti anādya ātma viparyaya graham
translated: By the service of whose feet, by the intense knowledge of the Self, they remove the misconception of the beginningless Self,

original: labhanta ātmīyam anantam aiśvaraṃ kuto nu mohaḥ paramasya sadgateḥ🔽taṃ śastrapūgaiḥ praharantam ojasā🔽śālvaṃ śaraiḥ śaurir amoghavikramaḥ
analyzed: labhante ātmīyam anantam aiśvaram kutas nu mohaḥ paramasya sat gateḥ  tam śastra pūgaiḥ praharantam ojasā  śālvam śaraiḥ śauriḥ amogha vikramaḥ
translated: And attain their own infinite lordship, how then is there delusion for the highest good?🔽Śālva, who was striking with a multitude of weapons with great force,🔽Śauri (Kṛṣṇa), of unfailing prowess, pierced him with arrows,

analyzed: viddhvā ācchinat varma dhanuḥ śiromaṇim
translated: And cut off his armor, bow, and crest-jewel,

original: saubhaṃ ca śatror gadayā ruroja ha
analyzed: saubham ca śatroḥ gadayā ruroja ha
translated: And with his club, he crushed his enemy's Saubha chariot.

original: tat kṛṣṇahasteritayā vicūrṇitaṃ papāta toye gadayā sahasradhā🔽visṛjya tad bhūtalam āsthito gadām udyamya śālvo 'cyutam abhyagād drutam
analyzed: tat kṛṣṇa hasta īritayā vicūrṇitam papāta toye gadayā sahasradhā  visṛjya tat bhū talam āsthitaḥ gadām udyamya śālvaḥ cyutam abhyagāt drutam
translated: That (Saubha chariot), shattered by the club hurled by Kṛṣṇa's hand, fell into the water in a thousand pieces.🔽Abandoning that (Saubha chariot), Śālva, standing on the ground, quickly approached Acyuta (Kṛṣṇa), raising his club.

original: ādhāvataḥ sagadaṃ tasya bāhuṃ bhallena chittvātha rathāṅgam adbhutam🔽vadhāya śālvasya layārkasannibhaṃ bibhrad babhau sārka ivodayācalaḥ

analyzed: praviṣṭānām mahā araṇyam apartau su mahat dvija

analyzed: vāta varṣam abhūt tīvram niṣṭhurāḥ stanayitnavaḥ
translated: a violent storm arose, with fierce thunderclaps.

original: sūryaś cāstaṃ gatas tāvat tamasā cāvṛtā diśaḥ
analyzed: sūryaḥ ca astam gataḥ tāvat tamasā ca āvṛtāḥ diśaḥ

original: nimnaṃ kūlaṃ jalamayaṃ na prājñāyata kiñcana
analyzed: nimnam kūlam jala mayam na prājñāyata kiñcana
translated: The low-lying bank became full of water, and nothing could be seen.

analyzed: vayam bhṛśam tatra mahā anila ambubhiḥ nihanyamānāḥ ambu samplave

analyzed: diśaḥ tha parasparam vane gṛhīta hastāḥ paribabhrima āturāḥ
translated: not knowing the directions, we wandered about in the forest, holding each other's hands, being distressed.

original: etad viditvā udite ravau sāndīpanir guruḥ
analyzed: etat viditvā udite ravau sāndīpaniḥ guruḥ

analyzed: aho he putrakāḥ yūyam asmad arthe ti duḥkhitāḥ

analyzed: ātmā vai prāṇinām preṣṭhaḥ tam an ādṛtya mad parāḥ

analyzed: chandāṃsi ayātayāmāni bhavantu iha paratra ca

analyzed: guroḥ anugraheṇa eva pumān pūrṇaḥ praśāntaye

analyzed: śrī brāhmaṇaḥ uvāca
translated: The Brahmin said:

analyzed: yasya chandaḥ mayam brahma dehe āvapanam vibho

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca

analyzed: bhūri api a bhakta upahṛtam na me toṣāya kalpate

analyzed: sarva bhūta ātma dṛś sākṣāt tasya āgamana kāraṇam

analyzed: ittham vicintya vasanāt cīra baddhān dvijanmanaḥ

original: darśanasparśanapraśna prahvapādārcanādikam🔽na hy ammayāni tīrthāni na devā mṛcchilāmayāḥ
analyzed: na hi am mayāni tīrthāni na devāḥ mṛd śilā mayāḥ
translated: the sight, touch, questioning, bowing down to their feet, worship and so on?🔽For the holy ones purify merely by being seen, unlike the water-based holy places,

original: te punanty urukālena darśanād eva sādhavaḥ
analyzed: te punanti uru kālena darśanāt eva sādhavaḥ

original: nāgnir na sūryo na ca candratārakā

analyzed: upāsitāḥ bheda kṛtaḥ haranti agham

analyzed: vipaścitaḥ ghnanti muhūrta sevayā  yasya ātma buddhiḥ kuṇape tri dhātuke
translated: But those who are not very advanced in spiritual knowledge, and who are simply engaged in the service of the body, can destroy the reactions of sinful life only by the association of the devotees for a short time.

original: svadhīḥ kalatrādiṣu bhauma ijyadhīḥ🔽yattīrthabuddhiḥ salile na karhicij
analyzed: sva dhīḥ kalatra ādiṣu bhaumaḥ ijya dhīḥ  yat tīrtha buddhiḥ salile na karhicit

analyzed: janeṣu abhijñeṣu saḥ eva go kharaḥ
translated: and who never thinks of the holy places of pilgrimage as the self, and who thinks of the brāhmaṇas as ordinary men, is just like a donkey or a cow.

analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca  niśamya ittham bhagavataḥ kṛṣṇasya akuṇtha medhasaḥ
translated: Śrī Śukadeva Gosvāmī said:

analyzed: vacaḥ duranvayam viprāḥ tūṣṇīm āsan bhramat dhiyaḥ  ciram vimṛśya munayaḥ īśvarasya īśitavya tām

analyzed: śrī munayaḥ ūcuḥ

original: yanmāyayā tattvaviduttamā vayaṃ vimohitā viśvasṛjām adhīśvarāḥ🔽yad īśitavyāyati gūḍha īhayā aho vicitram bhagavadviceṣṭitam🔽anīha etad bahudhaika ātmanā sṛjaty avaty atti na badhyate yathā
analyzed: yad māyayā tattva vid uttamāḥ vayam vimohitāḥ viśvasṛjām adhīśvarāḥ  yat gūḍhe īhayā aho vicitram bhagavat viceṣṭitam  anīhaḥ etat bahudhā ekaḥ ātmanā sṛjati avati atti na badhyate yathā
translated: We are the best of all the knowers of truth, and we are the masters of the creators of the universe. But we are bewildered by Your illusory energy.🔽You are the controller of all controllers, and You are hidden in the heart of everyone. Still, You are acting as if You are under the control of others. Oh, the activities of the Supreme Lord are very wonderful.🔽The Supreme Lord, who is free from all material desires, creates this universe in various ways by His own potency. He maintains it and annihilates it, and yet He is never bound by the reactions of His actions.

original: bhaumair hi bhūmir bahunāmarūpiṇī aho vibhūmnaś caritaṃ viḍambanam

translated: If you wander with the intention of liberation from the other, then
